title: lyney_(genshin_impact)
body:
[[Genshin Impact]] male character.

An young man magician part of the House of the Hearth with his twin sister, [[lynette_(genshin_impact)|Lynette]], and his adoptive brother [[freminet_(genshin_impact)|Freminet]].

As kids, they lived on the streets and did magic tricks to get money, but one day, after they were adopted by an aristocratic man who tried to traffic with his sister. They were rescued by [[arlecchino_(genshin_impact)|Arlecchino]], and joined them in the House of the Hearth, thus becoming Fatui spies.

h4. Appearance

title: furina_(genshin_impact)
body:
A playable hydro character in [[Genshin Impact]]. She is the human vessel of the Hydro Archon Focalors, the God of Justice.
She is voiced by [[Minase Inori]] (Japanese) and [[Amber Lee Connors (voice actor)|]] (English).

She has [[white hair|white]] and [[blue hair]] that is either worn in a [[long hair|long]] [[ponytail]] or cut [[short hair|short]], a large [[ahoge]] and [[heterochromia|heterochromatic]] [[blue eyes]] with [[mismatched pupils|mismatched]] [[drop-shaped pupils]]. She is dressed in a blue [[ouji fashion]] outfit with a [[top hat]].

Her signature weapon is [[Splendor of Tranquil Waters (genshin Impact)|]].

h4. Appearance

title: airbus_a350xwb
body:
A Chinese artist, known for creating character illustrations for the game *Honkai Impact 3rd*. They experimented with early AI tools (e.g., Stable Diffusion 1.5) for image creation around late 2022, but later works carry no AIGC labels. The artist has since explicitly stated opposition to [[AI-generated]] content creation.Upload with caution.

Not to be confused with the [[Airbus A350]] tag.

title: layla_(genshin_impact)
body:
A playable Cryo character in [[Genshin Impact]].

Born in a rural part north of Sumeru City, Layla is a student in the Akademiya's Rtawhaist Darshan, who specializes in theoretical astrology. She suffers from a chronic sleep condition that leaves her perpetually sleepy, but doesn't allow her to sleep well at night.

She has [[yellow eyes]], [[pointy ears]], and [[long hair|long]] [[blue hair]] with [[drill sidelocks]]. She wears a [[blue hood]] and [[white pantyhose]]. Her clothing is black and blue with [[gold trim]] accents.

Her [[Vision (genshin impact)|]] element is Cryo, and she wields a [[sword]] in battle.

h4. Appearance

title: alhaitham_(genshin_impact)
body:
A playable character from [[Genshin Impact]]. A member of the Sumeru Akademiya's Haravatat who is known as the "Scribe". 

He is portrayed with [[short hair|short]] [[grey hair]] with [[green hair|green]] [[streaked hair|streaks]] and [[antenna hair|two ahoge]], and [[green eyes]]. His outfit consists of a golden [[headpiece]] covering his ears, [[black shirt|black]] [[compression shirt]] with [[detached sleeves|detached]] [[long sleeves]], [[black cape|black]]-[[green cape|green]] [[cape]], [[black gloves|black]] [[partially fingerless gloves]], [[black pants]], and [[knee boots|knee-length]] [[black boots]]. 

His localized name has a spelling mistake, where it should be written as either Al Haitham or Al-Haitham, with "Al" being translated as "The", which is comparable to writing [[Signora (genshin impact)|La Signora]] as "Lasignora" or [[Statue of The Seven]] as "Statue of Theseven".

h4. Appearance

title: yae_miko
body:
[[Genshin Impact]] character.

Yae Miko is the chief priest of the Grand Narukami Shrine, which she oversees and also the CEO of the namesake Yae Publishing House. She is mentioned by the [[Raiden Shogun]] when the Archon speaks of [[Zhongli (genshin impact)|]]. She is an "old friend" of Morax and Baal, and is acquainted with [[Ganyu (genshin impact)|]].

Her attire is a [[nontraditional miko]] garment, consisting of a [[sleeveless shirt|sleeveless]] [[white shirt]] paired with [[detached sleeves]] and a [[red skirt]]. Despite her [[Japanese clothes]], her outfit is not a [[kimono]] and should not be tagged as one.

She is loosely based on [[Yae Sakura]] from [[honkai_impact_3rd|Honkai Impact 3rd]], another game made by miHoYo, and shares Chinese (Du Mingya) and Japanese ([[Sakura Ayane]]) voice actresses.

h4. Appearance

title: vali_(fire_emblem)
body:
Character in [[Fire Emblem Heroes]].

Vali is [[Baldr (Fire Emblem Heroes)|]]'s youngest sister, whom Vali looks up to and is extremely protective of. Known as the "Goddess of Vengeance," she has a childish, vindictive personality who will never stop fighting until she has fulfilled her vengeance against anyone she declares her enemy. As a matter of fact, the more she loses, the stronger she becomes, eventually overwhelming the object of her vengeance.

Notably, she is often seen holding a [[doll]] shaped like Baldr, which she utilizes as her weapon: It is capable of growing to a gigantic size and is able to shoot lasers from its eyes.

title: raiden_shogun
body:
A playable character in [[Genshin Impact]], the Electro Archon who governs Inazuma. Notable for her [[human scabbard|peculiar sword drawing technique]], in which she manifests the [[tachi (weapon)|]] [[Musou Isshin (Genshin Impact)|]] from her [[cleavage]].

Also known as Baal or "the Shogun". 

During the story, it is revealed her name is [spoiler]Ei, and her Archon name is Beelzebul[/spoiler]. The name Baal [spoiler]was a title that actually belonged to her twin sister[/spoiler]. 

Raiden Shogun has [[purple hair]] and [[purple eyes]], the former which is tied in a [[long braid]] and is adorned with a [[hair ornament]]. She wears a [[purple kimono]] worn [[off shoulder|hanging off her arms]], tied with a [[red sash|red]] [[obi]] and adorned with a [[shoulder armor]]. She wears [[black thighhighs]] and [[high heels|high-heeled]] [[sandals]]. Typically wields a [[katana]] called [[Musou Isshin (Genshin Impact)|]].

His signature weapon is [[Engulfing Lightning (Genshin Impact)|Engulfing Lightning]].

She is related to [spoiler][[makoto (genshin impact)|Raiden Makoto]][/spoiler], who is her [spoiler]twin sister[/spoiler].

h4. Appearance

title: oozora_subaru_(casual)
body:
The 5th [[official alternate costume|costume]] of [[hololive]]'s [[Oozora Subaru]].

It's a [[french girly]] fashion costume based on the [[virgin killer outfit]] and consists of a dark [[blue hat|blue]] [[beret]] with a star decoration, long-sleeved [[frilled shirt|frilled]] [[white shirt]] with a [[frilled shirt collar]] and [[center frills]] a [[red bowtie]], a [[pink sweater|pink]] [[aran sweater]], a [[frilled skirt|frilled]] [[blue skirt|dark blue]] [[plaid skirt|plaid]] [[button up skirt|button-up]] [[high-waist skirt]] a [[black pantyhose]] and [[red shoes|red]] [[mary janes]]. Additionally, this outfit was intentionally designed by [[Shigure Ui (VTuber)|]] to match with [[shigure ui (vtuber) (casual)|her own new outfit]], which was revealed a day later.

She has 3 different [[official alternate hairstyle|official hairstyles]] in this costume:

* [[Short hair]] with [[swept bangs]] and a [[side braid]] held with a [[white ribbon|]] [[hair ribbon]]
* [[long hair|Long]] [[straight hair]] with the same braid and ribbon as above
* Long hair tied into [[twintails]] with [[red ribbon|red]] [[hair ribbon|ribbons]]

h4. Appearance

title: zhongli_(genshin_impact)
body:
[[Genshin Impact]] character.

Wangsheng Funeral Parlor's mysterious consultant. Handsome, elegant, and surpassingly learned. Though no one knows where Zhongli is from, he is a master of courtesy and rules. From his seat at Wangsheng Funeral Parlor, he performs all manner of rituals.

[spoiler]His true identity is [[Rex Lapis (Genshin Impact)|]], The Geo Archon.[/spoiler]

As a result of certain in-game lore, he is sometimes drawn in a [[genderswap_(mtf)|female form]].

His name is pronounced [b]Shouri[/b] in the Japanese version of the game.

title: xinyan_(genshin_impact)
body:
[[Genshin Impact]] character.

Liyue's sole rock 'n' roll musician. She rebels against ossified prejudices using her music and passionate singing.  Xinyan's performances can get so intense that her impromptu stage is set ablaze, often burning the surroundings.  Xinyan insists that these pyrotechnics are the apex of performative art, and that they are physical phenomena that have nothing to do with her [[vision_(genshin_impact)|Vision]].

She has [[dark-skinned female|dark, tanned skin]], [[yellow_eyes|amber eyes]], and [[brown_hair|dark brown hair]], which she wears pulled back into [[two_side_up|two pigtails]] with spiked bands. One lock at the front of her hair is a dark red.  Xinyan wears a [[black_tank_top|black-brown tank top]] and [[white shorts]], with a red and white [[vest]] with flared red, black and white sleeves. She has a black and [[red ribbon]] tied around her right leg, and a netted sock on her left. Xinyan typically carries a white, brown, and red square [[lute_(instrument)|lute]] with an axe-like bottom.

Her name is pronounced [b]Shin'en[/b] in the Japanese version of the game.

h4. Appearance

* !post #4226801
* !post #5576191: [[Xinyan (2Nd Anniversary) (Genshin Impact)|2nd Anniversary]]

title: mizu_happi
body:
A mizu [[happi]] is a type of [[Japanese clothes]] worn during a [[Shinto]] [[festival]] by those carrying the yamakasa, a type of float. It consists of a [[fundoshi]] and a small cloth jacket tied together from the front with a knot. Due to the revealing nature of the clothes, men are the ones to wear them, though women are often drawn wearing them for fanservice reasons.

title: gate_-_jieitai_ka_no_chi_nite_kaku_tatakaeri
body:
ゲート 自衛隊彼の地にて、斯く戦えり (ゲート じえいたいかのちにてかくたたかえり) 
"Gate - Thus the JSDF Fought There", or simply "Gate". 

A light novel series by Yanai Takumi, based on his own online novella, illustrated by [[Izuka Daisuke]]. 

In August 20XX, a portal to a parallel world known as the "Gate", suddenly appeared in [[ginza (tokyo)|Ginza, Tokyo]] where monsters and human warriors wearing ancient armor poured out of the portal, killing everyone in their way and trying to claim the area as their own. This would later be known as the "The Ginza Incident". Immediately after the attack, the [[Japan Ground Self-Defense Force]]s launches a counter attack, repelling and pushing the invaders back to the Gate and reclaiming Ginza. 

A manga adaptation is adapted by [[Sao Satoru]]. A TV anime adaptation aired Summer 2015 with a continuation in Winter 2016.

Due to the overall theme, the series have been chosen by the [[Japan Self-defense Force]] as a promotional and a recruiting tool for the JSDF since 2016.

An anime adaptation of the sequel novel series "Gate Season 2 - Jieitai Kano Umi nite, Kaku Tatakaeri" (lit. "Gate Season 2: Thus the Japanese Self-Defense Force Fought in Their Sea"; English title: "Gate 2: Tides of Conflict") was announced in the works July 2025.

h5. Special Region

* [[Tuka Luna Marceau]]
* [[Lelei la Lalena]]
* [[Rory Mercury]]
* [[Molto Sol Augustus]] 
* [[Pina Co Lada (gate)|Piña Co Lada]]

* [[Yao Haa Dushi]]
* [[Persia (gate)|]]

h5. Japan

* [[Itami Youji]], First Lieutenant/otaku

* [[Kuribayashi Shino]], Sergeant First Class

* [[Aoi Risa]], Itami's ex-wife

h4.See also

title: hu_tao_(genshin_impact)
body:
A playable Pyro character in [[Genshin Impact]]. She is the 77th Director of the Wangsheng Funeral Parlor, a person vital to managing Liyue's funerary affairs.

She has [[red eyes]], [[long hair|long]] [[brown hair]], and she wears brown clothing. She has a [[ghost]] companion called [[Boo Tao (genshin impact)|]].

Many of her attacks scale based on how low her HP is. As a result, comic fanart tends to depict her as [[masochism|masochistic]], or at the very least disliking healers.

In Chinese and Japanese, the two kanji that spell Hu Tao's name have the meaning of "walnut", but Hu is her family name while Tao is her given name. She is the only Liyue character with her family name displayed on the in-game character menu. Japanese fans sometimes accidentally (or deliberately) misspell her name as [i]Kurumi[/i], the Japanese word for "walnut"; however, her name is pronounced Hu Tao even in the Japanese version of the game.

title: fischl_(genshin_impact)
body:
[[Genshin Impact]] character.

A mysterious girl who calls herself "Prinzessin der Verurteilung" and travels with a night [[crow]] named [[Oz (genshin impact)|]].
Currently serves as an investigator in the Adventurers' Guild.

Through her unique abilities, [[chuunibyou]] personality, and (while she would never admit it herself) hard work, Fischl has become a rising star among the Adventurers' Guild's investigators, earning the recognition of all.

She has a petite build, light [[green eyes]], [[small breasts]], and [[blonde hair|blonde]] [[two side up]] hair with a [[black ribbon|black]] bat-winged [[hair ribbon]]. She wears a black [[eyepatch]] to not obstruct her view when possessing Oz.

Overall, Fischl seems to have designed her outfit to be as asymmetrical as physically possible. She wears a sleeveless black lace dress-like [[leotard]] with a black lace [[collar]] and [[purple bowtie]], crosses stitched in, and black and violet [[tailcoat]]s. Her [[vision (genshin impact)|]] is tied to the back of this dress with a bat wing-style [[purple ribbon]]. She wears a shoulder-length black [[gloves|glove]] on her left hand and a black and purple [[single_sleeve|sleeve]] or [[single bridal gauntlet]] on her right arm. She wears a transparent black [[single_thighhigh|thighhigh]] on her right leg and a similar thigh-high black sock held up by [[garter straps]] on her left. She wears [[black_footwear|black]] [[boots]] with a light purple lining, gold [[high_heels|heels]], and [[bat_ornament|bat wing decorations]].

In general, Fischl seems to style herself after the titular character of said book "Flowers for Princess Fischl".

Her full name is Fischl von Luftschloss Narfidort. Actual name: Amy.

She also appears in [[Honkai Impact 3rd]] as a playable character.

Chinese CV: Mace
Japanese CV: [[Uchida Maaya]]

title: pachirisu
body:
[[pokemon (creature)|Pokémon]] #0417 in the National Pokédex, an Electric-type.

Resembles a [[squirrel]]. Has [[white fur]] and a light blue stripe from its forehead to the tip of its tail.

Despite generally being a weak Pokémon, it was famously used to great effect by [[Se Jun Park]] in the [[Pokemon World Championships 2014|2014 Video Game World Championships]].

title: follow_me_(pokemon)
body:
[b]Kono Yubi Tomare[/b] (Japanese, meaning [i]Stay With This Finger[/i]), [b]Follow Me[/b] (English)[b] 날따름[/b](Korean)

Follow Me is a [i][[pokemon|Pokémon]][/i] move.

When a Pokémon uses Follow Me, any moves used by the opponent(s) are forced to target it (rather than other intended targets).

In battle animation, a floating white glove pointing up usually appears close to the user. This is a reference to the Japanese name of this move.

h5. Pokémon World Championship

Some posts involve a [[Pachirisu]] using Follow Me (post #1793246, post #3555002, etc.). They are usually about [[Se Jun Park]]'s Pachirisu, which was a member of his winning team in the [[Pokemon World Championships 2014|Pokémon VGC World Championship 2014]].

h4. See also

* [[list of pokemon moves|List of Pokémon moves]]

body:

title: amber_(genshin_impact)
body:
A playable [[Genshin Impact]] character.

A perky, straightforward girl, who is also the only Outrider of the Knights of Favonius. Her amazing mastery of the glider has made her a three-time winner of the Gliding Champion in Mondstadt. As a rising star within the Knights of Favonius, Amber is always ready for any challenging tasks.

She has [[long hair|long]], [[brown hair]], [[small breasts|small]]/[[medium breasts]], [[brown eyes]], and fair skin. She wears a jumper-like outfit composed of dark brown leather [[shorts]], a red hoodie-like top, red [[thighhighs]], and white thigh-high [[boots]] embellished with gold linings and symbols.

Her elemental skill is [[Baron Bunny (genshin Impact)|]].

title: hearts_of_iron
body:
A series of grand strategy games set during [[World War II]] developed by Paradox Interactive. The games allow users to alter the course of the war via various means, from Germany winning the war to Japan joining the Allies.

The fourth entry in the series, Hearts of Iron IV, especially has been successful, due to its greater accessibility compared to its predecessor, and greater ease of modding, resulting in feature-rich mods which may even completely transform the scenario.

title: howto:named_outfits
body:
h4.This wiki is still a WIP, and its ruleset hasn't been applied yet. See topic #17377 for the relevant discussion.

[expand=Table of Contents]
* 1 "Terminology":#dtext-term
* 2 "Danbooru’s Tagging Guidelines":#dtext-guidelines
** 2.01 "Default + One Variant":#dtext-onevariant
** 2.02 "One Costume For Multiple Characters":#dtext-onecosmultichara
** 2.03 "Cosplay":#dtext-cosplay
** 2.04 "Characters From Existing Copyrights":#dtext-existing
* 3 "List of Gacha Games":#dtext-gamelist
[/expand]

This is a guide on how to tag characters and their alternate outfits that appear in gacha-styled mobile games.

Throughout recent years, there lacked a means of standardizing how alternate costumes for characters in gacha games should be tagged on Danbooru. The conventions that work for one title may not work so well for another, which then leads to inconsistencies and confusion. The aim is to define why there is a difference between video game media and other forms of media when it comes to handling characters and named outfits, and then use already-existing tagging conventions and examples to clarify things. This process can then be standardized so that what works for one gacha game can work for another, rather than users making up unique rules on a game-to-game basis that will wind up conflicting with each other.

As discussed in the forums however, [[Fate/Grand Order]] has been separated into its own discussion due to the unique circumstances surrounding how it releases characters and alternate outfits. This article has deliberately excluded any examples from that game for this purpose. Please go to topic #17356 ("The Fate/Grand Retagging Project") if you wish to discuss tagging conventions for F/GO specifically.

h4#term. TERMINOLOGY

[i]Gacha[/i] (ガチャ) is shorthand for [i]gachapon[/i] (ガチャポン), which in itself is an alternate saying of [[gashapon]] (ガシャポン). Whatever the reading, this is a type of Japanese-produced vending machine that customers dispense money into, then they twist a crank and the machine dispenses a plastic egg containing a randomly-selected toy or prize. Usually this is one toy out of a collectible set, incentivizing customers to pay more to complete the collection. [i]Gasha/gacha[/i] is the Japanese onomatopoeia for the sound of the crank being twisted, while [i]pon[/i] is the sound of the toy dropping into the receptacle.

Similarly, a gacha video game is a branch of mobile gaming where players save up a fictional in-game currency, then use it to [i]roll[/i] the virtual vending machine (think of spinning a slot machine or roulette wheel). What players roll for tend to be desired characters, character classes, weapons, vehicles, materials, add-ons or whatnot. The majority of this discussion is going to cover characters and named outfits, since Danbooru is a character-based imageboard.

h4#guidelines. DANBOORU’S TAGGING GUIDELINES

Due to the complex nature of gacha games and how they release characters, alternate costumes, and/or alternate forms, Danbooru’s guidelines for separating everything with tags work somewhat differently from non-gacha titles. Make note that these conventions are not exclusive to gacha games - console games and MMORPGs also use similar systems for releasing characters and alternate forms/outfits. This article primarily focuses on gacha games because the bulk of new releases tend to originate from there, but it is not a concept exclusive to gachas. Regardless of what game type is being dealt with, there are some categories to go over with how these are treated here.

The crux of this article comes from when an already-released character is recycled and given a different costume. This then complicates tagging these alternate costumes because while they literally are the same character just wearing a different outfit, the game itself treats them as an entirely different character by giving that costume an official name. Compounding things is that these characters may possess different skill sets, character classes, and/or be categorized according to an in-game ID number, further proving that the developers intended for these alternate costumes to be treated as full characters.

That last sentence is especially important for Danbooru’s purposes, particularly the phrase, [b]"Alternate costumes to be treated as full characters".[/b] When it comes to video games, that is how a [i]named outfit[/i] should be treated here – with a character tag, not just treating it as the same character wearing a different outfit. For Danbooru’s purposes, this is called a [i]variant[/i]. Other terms that can be used interchangeably are [i]forms[/i], [i]versions[/i], and [i]alternate costumes[/i], but this article will stick to the term [i]variant[/i] for consistency's sake.
 
This has been a growing source of confusion in the last few years for one reason: [b]Most forms of media don't name their alternate outfits.[/b] For a non-video game example, [[Yoko Littner]]'s swimsuit (post #178763) that she wears in a single episode of [[Tengen Toppa Gurren Lagann]] doesn't have an official name attached to it; it's just a swimsuit. Another example is [[Tomoe Hotaru]]'s black dress (post #2227732) that she frequently wears in [[Bishoujo Senshi Sailor Moon]]. The creators never assigned a name to it; it's just a dress she wears. Therefore, regardless if the costume comes from an anime, video game, movie, book, or other form of media, if the creators/developers don't give a name to an alternate outfit, then don't give it one here.

[i]Further discussion is needed regarding an outfit that was initially released without a name, then retroactively given a name later in the franchise's life, and whether or not it should be likewise retroactively tagged with a new character tag. While this is uncommon, it does happen.
- Benit149[/i]

In contrast, a gacha example would be [[Azur Lane]]'s [[Sirius (azur lane)|]], who has a swimsuit that is officially named [[sirius (scorching-hot seirios) (azur lane)|Scorching-Hot Seirios]]. This means that it should be given the same treatment here by denoting a character tag (or [i]chartag[/i]) to it.

[b]That is the primary difference between tagging characters and outfits from gacha games and those from non-gacha titles.[/b] Official sources will name a character's alternate outfit, and Danbooru users then tag according to whatever conventions the official sources use.

h6#onevariant. DEFAULT + ONE VARIANT

Using the Sirius example mentioned above, the variant of her that was released first in Azur Lane is considered to be her [i]default variant[/i], or just [i]default[/i]. The default's tag would be:

* [[sirius_(azur_lane)]]

Danbooru already has a tagging system that pairs character names with the copyright as a qualifier, separating them from a character with the same name in a different copyright (called [i]disambiguator[/i] here). Later in the game's life, the aforementioned swimsuit variant is released. This would be her [i]holiday variant[/i]. By this, this refers to limited-time variants who are only available during a specific period of the year, and their character designs will often reflect this. The three most popular holidays are Summer (or 'Swimsuit' variants), Halloween, and Christmas. Some gacha games may incorporate other holidays like Valentines or Easter for character design purposes. Another catchall term that can be used is [i]special variant[/i] if there is no holiday attached to the costume.

To facilitate this, a new chartag is created:

* [[sirius (scorching-hot seirios) (azur lane)|]]

The original sirius_(azur_lane) chartag is also added to function as an umbrella tag, compiling any and every post of Sirius regardless of variants. If a user then wanted to exclude Midsummer Seirios from a search and just look up Sirius' default variant, they can then do a {{sirius_(azur_lane) -sirius_(midsummer_seirios)_(azur_lane)}} search. The naming convention for a holiday/special variant's chartag would be:

* character_(holiday/special_variant)_(copyright)

Another way that named outfits are released is through a character [i]skin[/i]. In gaming terms, this is an alternate costume that only serves to function as a cosmetic change for a character, without changing the character's in-game functionality. Contrast this to [i]variant[/i], where a character's outfit [u]and[/u] in-game functionality change. So long as the skin has been given an official name, the same tagging convention for a holiday/special variant can also work for a skin.

[i]There is some debate as to whether or not the default should get the same treatment as the holiday variant for consistency’s sake, or if it’s best to just leave them as is. At the moment, the default is left as-is.
- Benit149[/i]

Another way generally involves standardized names based on a gacha game's upgrade routes. Though previously rendered as general tags (or [i]gentags[/i]), covering multiple characters with one standard tag, they have since been split up to individually cover characters. Generally, these designate a character who wears a new costume when they reach their final upgrade, but several gacha games employ unique costumes for each upgrade level. Examples of either/or include [[Kantai Collection]], which has [[Remodel (kantai collection)|]]s, [[Warship Girls R]] and its [[Remodel (warship girls r)|]]s, [[Azur Lane]] and its [[Retrofit (azur lane)|]]s, [[Girls' Frontline]] and its [[MOD3 (girls' frontline)|]]s, [[Touken Ranbu]] and its [[Kiwame (touken ranbu)|]], and more. These should follow the above-presented format, but the middle brackets having the shared upgrade route.

h6#onecosmultichara. ONE COSTUME FOR MULTIPLE CHARACTERS

As implied earlier, sometimes there is a singular tag that will cover multiple characters with one brush stroke. However, while the above accounted several different types of costumes under one shared concept, traditionally this would imply a shared alternate costume, like uniforms.

As an example, [[Idolmaster]] has named thematic outfits that multiple characters of a band will wear as a sort of uniform (barring minor design changes per character), like [[Cute & Girly (idolmaster)|]], [[Sailor Swimsuit (idolmaster)|]], or [[Cool & Sexy (idolmaster)|]].

At the moment, this is the only category that uses gentags rather than specific chartags. 

[i]More discussion is needed as to whether or not it is desirable to leave it like this or to expand them as chartags. The crux of the argument is that gentags wind up getting 'lost' in the quagmire of dozens of other gentags describing everything in an image, while making chartags for every instance is far too cumbersome and pedantic.
- Benit149[/i]

h6#cosplay. COSPLAY

Use the default variant's chartag when dealing with any and all *_(cosplay) tags:

* character_(copyright)_(cosplay)

If you are uploading a cosplay of a holiday/special variant, then tag it like this:

* character1_(copyright) [i](chartag)[/i]
** character1_(copyright)_(cosplay) [i](gentag)[/i]
** character1_(holiday/special_variant)_(copyright) [i](chartag)[/i]
* character2_(copyright) [i](chartag)[/i]

h6#existing. CHARACTERS FROM EXISTING COPYRIGHTS

As stated in the introduction, characters who already exist in previous forms of media are transferred into gacha games as prizes to be rolled for. Does this mean existing characters have to be renamed to fit with them being in a gacha game?

The simple answer is, no. Stick to the chartags that already exist, and use the gacha's copyright tag only if an image is applicable to the gacha game, like a gacha-exclusive named costume for a character.

Gacha games still have a copyright tag because original characters and/or concepts unique to the game will pop up, which means that the copyright tag has to function as their origin. With [[Wild Arms: Million Memories]], we have [[Brittany Shrewsbury]]; for [[Tales of the Rays]], we have [[Ix Nieves]] and [[Mileena Weiss]]; for [[Star Ocean: Anamnesis]], we have [[evelysse (star ocean)|Evelysse]]; for the [[Magia Record: Mahou Shoujo Madoka Magica Gaiden|Madoka Magica]] game, we have [[Tamaki Iroha]], [[Futaba Sana]], [[Yui Tsuruno]] and others. So on and so forth.

Likewise, [[official art]] of existing characters can fall under the gacha's copyright since that's where it's being marketed.

H4#gamelist. LIST OF GAMES WITH NAMED OUTFITS

Let's get into the games that these guidelines are applicable to. Some of them are mobile spin-offs of existing copyrights, while others are wholly original titles. Regardless if the game is active or defunct, they will go here. The titles will be listed in alphabetical order.

To reiterate, [[Fate/Grand Order]] has been excluded from this article entirely, and thus from this list as well.

[b]This is an ongoing work-in-progress. Any contributions made will be greatly appreciated.[/b]

* [[Another Eden]]

title: white_glint
body:
A powerful, middleweight, all-white Armored Core NEXT [[mecha]] piloted by a Lynx with the callsign 'Unknown'. Its arsenal is composed of twin multi-missile launchers on both shoulders, a standard rifle on the right arm, a fast-fire rifle on the left arm, [[Vanguard Overed Boost]] (VOB) capability for high-speed missions, and Assault Armor that can be used to eliminate enemies up close.

This tag refers to the successor NEXT from [[Armored Core: For Answer]] piloted by Unknown, who is presumably the Anatolia's Mercenary (the player character from [[Armored Core 4]]).
For the NEXT piloted by their predecessor, Joshua O'Brien, see [[White Glint (Armored Core 4)]].

h4. See Also
* [[N-WGIX/v]]

title: g6_red
body:
A NPC in the game [[armored core vi: fires of rubicon|Armored Core VI: Fires of Rubicon]]. An augmented human and AC pilot associated with the Balam corporation group, a member of their in-house AC mercenary group 'Redguns', assigned the title G6 (Pronounced 'Gun 6') Red, referred to the Red River of the South in Texas, North America. He pilots the AC 'Hermit'.

As an [[Armored Core]] character, there is no canon depiction of Red in game, artists depictions may draw inspirations from the locals from the region used as his callsign, and/or from the AC he pilots.

Voiced by: Robby Daymond (EN), Okai Katsunori (JP)

title: g3_wu_huahai
body:
A NPC in the game [[armored core vi: fires of rubicon|Armored Core VI: Fires of Rubicon]]. An augmented human and AC pilot associated with the Balam corporation group, a member of their in-house AC mercenary group 'Redguns', assigned the title G3 (Pronounced 'Gun 3') Wu Huahai, referred to the Five Flower Lake (五花海) in the Jiuzhaigou natural reserve. He pilots the AC 'Li Long'.

As an [[Armored Core]] character, there is no canon depiction of Wu Huahai in game, but his Chinese callsign and his connection to Feng Shui likely influenced the [[Asian]] ethnicity in depictions.

Voiced by: Johnny Yong Bosch (EN), Gotou Hiroki (JP)

title: ima-no-tsurugi
body:
A [[Touken Ranbu]] character. Official art by [[shikimi (yurakuru)|Shikimi]]. Voiced by [[Yamashita Daiki]].

He is (allegedly) the personal [[tantou]] of [[Minamoto no Yoshitsune]]. Dressed like a tengu as an homage to his owner having allegedly been trained by one. As he said in his introductory line, he was there from his owner's time at the temple to his very last moment. 

Has [[long hair|long]] [[white hair]] and [[red eyes]]. He wears a [[tokin hat]] with a [[chin strap]], some sort of [[stole]]. Has a [[sode]] on his left shoulder, a [[kusazuri]] and wears [[tengu-geta]]. His [[Ima-no-tsurugi (Kiwame)|Kiwame]] form is dressed in more [[Japanese armor]], along with a bird headdress that mirrors his emotions.

Ima-no-tsurugi is a straightforward and cheerful child, treating fighting as though it's a game and boasting himself of being the fastest tantou. He has an extraordinary sense of balance and can jump about cheerfully on one-toothed geta. Despite his bonds with Minamoto no Yoshitsune, Ima-no-tsurugi is very loyal to the [[Saniwa (touken ranbu)|]], who he puts before himself. He's often seen hanging out with [[Iwatooshi]], due to their masters' shared past.  

After his Kiwame remodel, [spoiler]it's revealed he's a fictional sword and never interacted with Yoshitsune at all. Despite this, he understands that he exists because of the Saniwa, and vows to stay by their side and help them.[/spoiler]

h4. External links

* "Touken Ranbu Wiki: Imanotsurugi":http://touken-ranbu.wikia.com/wiki/Imanotsurugi

title: g1_michigan
body:
A NPC in the game [[armored core vi: fires of rubicon|Armored Core VI: Fires of Rubicon]]. An augmented human and AC pilot associated with the Balam corporation group, and the leader of their in-house AC mercenary group 'Redguns', assigned the title G1 (Pronounced 'Gun 1') Michigan, referenced the Great Lake Michigan. He is given the nickname 'Hell on four legs', as he pilots the quadrupedal AC '[[liger tail (armored core)|Liger Tail]]'.

As an [[Armored Core]] character, there is no canon depiction of Michigan in game, but he is often depicted as a military battle hardened veteran/drill sergeant, likely influenced by his in-game dialogues and the way he behaves.

Voiced by: D.C. Douglas (EN), Satou Setsuji (JP)

body:
The player's typical mission control in [[Armored Core Vi: Fires Of Rubicon]], Handler Walter has earned notoriety for using and disposing of augmented humans in high-risk missions throughout settled space. 
But in reality, Walter acts as a caring father-like figure to his subjects, respecting [[621 (armored core vi)|C4-621]]'s choice and their life.

As an [[Armored Core]] character, canonically his appearance is never depicted in full, but the Story Trailer suggests he uses a walking cane.

title: zhijupao
body:
A style of [[hanfu]] that was worn as informal wear during the Spring & Autumn Period, Warring States, Qin, and Han Dynasties. Its construction is that of a long wrap-around [[robe]] with a y-shaped collar and a [[sash]] around the waist or hips. Its hem is straight, this detail distinguishes it from the [[Qujupao]], which has a curved hem. These two styles are reffered to as "shenyi" and could be worn by any gender, making it unisex.

Shenyi could be confused to be [[kimono]], but shenyi is really the predecessor to kimono. The garment was brought to Japan where it overtime changed and became the kimono. Shenyi is generally much simpler to put on, which can help to distinguish them.

h4. Examples

* !post #7715728: Male 
* !post #8270392: Female
* !post #9659855

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Shenyi":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Shenyi#Zhijupao

body:

She has [[long hair|long]] [[blonde hair]] with a [[pink hair|pink]] [[gradient hair|gradient]], [[green eyes|green]]/[[aqua eyes]], [[pointy ears]] and [[large breasts]] with a [[winged heart]] [[winged heart tattoo|tattoo]] on her [[breast tattoo|left breast]]. Being a demon, she also has [[black horns|black]] [[demon horns]] with [[horn ring|ring]]s on her left horn, [[demon wings|wings]], and a [[demon tail]].

title: kirschtaria_wodime
body:
[[Fate/Grand Order]] character. The leader of the seven Crypters, the antagonists of the second story arc. His Lostbelt is divided into two sections - [[Atlantis (fate/grand order)|]] and [[Olympus (fate/grand order)|]]. He summons three servants in total, with [[Caenis (fate)|]] first appearing in the [[anastasia (lostbelt) (fate/grand order)|Anastasia]] Lostbelt with his other two servants [[Castor (fate)|]] and [[Pollux (fate)|]] appearing in the Atlantis Lostbelt proper. [spoiler]Because the Dioscuri twins count as one servant, he is able to conceal the existence of this third servant, the "Titan Atlas":https://typemoon.fandom.com/wiki/Titan_Atlas, from the [[Foreign Disciples (fate/grand order)|]].[/spoiler]

Frequently compared to [[Fionn mac Cumhaill (fate/grand order)|]] due to their incredibly similar physical characteristics.

[b]Character Design:[/b] [[Koyama Hirokazu]]
[b]Voice Actor:[/b] [[Saitou Souma]]

title: shining_finger
body:
A special move used by [[Shining Gundam]] in [[G Gundam]]. It envelops the right or left hand with glowing, hot energy and is then used to crush an enemy Gundam's head. 

There are two other variants of the move: [[Master Gundam]]'s ([[Master Asia]]) Darkness Finger and [[God Gundam]]'s (Domon Kasshu) [[Bakunetsu God Finger]]. [[Turn X]] ([[Gym Ghingnham]], [i][[Turn A Gundam]][/i]) also uses a version of the Shining Finger.

[[Destiny Gundam]]'s ([[Shinn Asuka]], [i][[Gundam SEED Destiny]][/i]) Palma Fiocina and [[Guren Mk-ii]]'s ([[Kouzuki Kallen]], [i][[Code Geass]][/i]) Fukushahadou are similar, but not exactly the same as the Shining Finger. Do not use this tag with these two [[mecha]] unless it's a direct imitation or parody.

Use this tag for all variants of the move being used, and (for [[parody]] purposes) if the character's hand appears to be "glowing with an awesome power" or "burning red".
other_names: シャイニングフィンガー

title: macross_7
body:
The second [[Macross]] science fiction anime TV series first broadcasted in October 16, 1994 and sequel to the  [[Choujikuu Yousai Macross]] TV series from the 80s.

It is set in the [[U.N. Spacy]] [b]Macross 7[/b] colony fleet during the year 2045, more than 30 years after the original series ended.

title: va-3
body:
A transformable [[mecha]] from the [[Macross]] universe. It first appeared in promotional material for the [[Macross Plus]] OVA from 1994 and has since been included as part of the franchise, appearing in several different publications and toy lines of the Macross saga during the years.

The [b]Northrom Grumman VA-3 Invader[/b] is a Variable Attacker (VA) airframe mass produced for the [[u.n._spacy|UN Forces]] for ground suppression with the special characteristics of both a [[Variable Fighter]] (VF) and a [[Destroid]] mecha.

The VA-3 was designed by [[Kawamori Shouji]] in the 90s for the Macross Plus series, but was not used in the OVA and thus never animated. The [i]Invader[/i] first appeared on pages 72-73 of the promotional book [i]This Is Animation Special: Macross Plus[/i] from 1995. Its variants, the VA-3C Custom (VA-3C Kai) appeared in OVA series [[Macross Dynamite 7]] and the VA-3M appeared in [[Macross VF-X2]].

h4.See also

* "Wikipedia article (JP)":[https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/VA-3_%E3%82%A4%E3%83%B3%E3%83%99%E3%83%BC%E3%83%80%E3%83%BC]

body:
A derivative of [[UTAU]] [[Kasane Teto]] as a [[nun]], created by [[Sidai Rusk uu]].

The artist also made a short [[animated]] version consisting of a [[fake screenshot]] with [[dialogue box|dialogue]] and asked fans to make music to go along with it. Many fans did so but the most prominent version was made by [[Haibara Memory]]. Their song ended up being expanded to a [[confession to sister (synthesizer v)|full length Synthesizer V song]] with a music video animated by Sidai Rusk uu.

title: avatar_of_lava_(genshin_impact)
body:
An enemy from [[Genshin Impact]].

Avatars of Lava are [[monster]]s that must constantly absorb heat to survive. The Eroding variant deals Geo damage and must be attacked with Pyro to fill it's Fury Gauge. The Fluid variant deals Pyro damage and they have no Fury Gauge, but high Pyro Resistance instead.

h4. Types

* !asset #29687218: Eroding
* !asset #29687256: Fluid

* "Genshin Impact Wiki: Avatar of Lava":https://genshin-impact.fandom.com/wiki/Avatar_of_Lava

title: consecrated_scorpion_(genshin_impact)
body:
An enemy from [[Genshin Impact]].

Consecrated Scorpions are [[Scorpion]]s that have become much larger and more powerful as a result of mutation from consuming the remains of gods, becoming imbued with the Electro element. They have also grown several [[bone]]-like structures throughout their bodies.

They deal high-damage Electro attacks and will also periodically enter a Phagocytic Form, which increases their RES. While in this form, a Phagocytic Energy Block will spawn and when destroyed, will temporarily paralyze the Consecrated Scorpion and cause them to lose a portion of their HP.

h4. Appearance

* !asset #29685636

h4. See also

* [[Consecrated Fanged Beast (genshin impact)|]]

title: fate/extella
body:
Fate/EXTELLA (フェイト/エクステラ, localized as [i]Fate/EXTELLA: The Umbral Star[/i]) is an action game for the [[Playstation 4]], [[Playstation Vita]], PC, and [[Nintendo Switch]], taking place in the [[Fate/EXTRA]] world. It has a sequel of its own, [[Fate/EXTELLA LINK]].

Fate/EXTELLA takes place after the Moon Holy Grail War depicted in [[Fate/EXTRA]], but [b]in a slightly different continuity from its events[/b] (similar to the three classic [[Fate (series)|]] routes). The plot is divided into several arcs, representing different but linked timelines. In each arc the player takes control of a different Hakuno, who must work with their Servant to overcome competing parties.

h4. Characters

h6. Main

* [[Nero Claudius (fate/extra)|]], Saber
* [[Tamamo no Mae (fate)|]], Caster

title: fate/extra_ccc
body:
Fate/EXTRA CCC  (フェイト／エクストラ) is a RPG and action game for the [[PlayStation Portable]] and a "sequel/companion" game to [[Fate/EXTRA]], released in Spring 2013.

The game is set on the Far Side of the Moon Cell, where [[BB_(fate/EXTRA)|]] used her abilities to create the Sakura Labyrinth. She brought over various Masters and Servants from the Moon Cell Holy Grail War on the Near Side, some taken instantly before their deletion and others brought during the sixth week. The story is described as [[Fate/EXTRA|EXTRA]]'s "[[Heaven's Feel]]" route. Essentially, it's an alternate continuation of its events.

Many of the supporting characters from [[Fate/EXTRA]] return.

h4. Characters

h6. Playable Masters

title: emma_sheen
body:
A fictional female character from the [[Gundam]] [[mecha]]verse. She first appeared in the [[Zeta Gundam]] anime TV series from 1985.

[spoiler]A former [[titans_(gundam)|Titans]] cadet and later [[GM Quel]] operator who defects to the [[AEUG]] after witnessing the Titans brutal methods, [b]Emma Sheen[/b] becomes the pilot of a [[Rick Dias]], the [[Gundam Mk II]] as well as its [[Super Gundam]] variant.[/spoiler] 

[spoiler]Sadly, Emma dies in [[Kamille Bidan]]'s arms at the final battle of the Gryps conflict, just after being mortally wounded by [[Yazan Gable]] in his [[Hambrabi]].[/spoiler]

title: gm_night_seeker
body:
A fictional manned giant combat robot from the [[Gundam]] [[mecha]]verse.

[b]RGM-79V GM-Nightseeker[/b]

A special operations and night attack ground [[gm_(mobile_suit)|GM]] [[mobile suit]] developed by the [[Earth Federation]] for assaults on [[Zeon]]ic bases in the dead of night. It was equipped with a more specialized and powerful optical sensor allowing it to see its enemies before they could see it and more potent thrusters to allow for softer landings and for greater jump height to get better angles on targets. 

Over the years several versions of the suit were developed by the EF adding parts and weapons from newer mass production suits like the [[GM II]], the [[Hambrabi]], the [[GM III]] and the [[Jegan]].

One revamped unit was seen piloted by EFF Captain [[yazan_gable|Vasuki]] 2 years after the end of [[zeta_gundam|The Gryps War]]. 

h4. Related development
* [[GM Night Seeker Space Type]]
other_names: ジム・ナイトシーカー

title: cicin_(genshin_impact)
body:
A common enemy from [[Genshin Impact]].

Cicins are small, [[bat (animal)|]]-like creatures with four small wings that can be found throughout Teyvat and can also be summoned in combat by [[Cicin Mage (genshin impact)|]]s. They have very low HP and can shoot elemental projectiles.

title: monty_tank
body:
A boss from the [[Mario (series)|Mario Series]], appearing in World 6 of [[New Super Mario Bros.]]. It is a [[Monty Mole]] driving a tank with Bullet Bill blasters. The player can defeat it by stomping on Monty's head three times, which is exposed when Monty comes out to throw [[Bob-omb]]s at them. The bob-ombs can be thrown back at the tank and when hit, it will fire [[Bullet Bill]]s and gain one extra level. The tank is invincible when Monty's head is hidden.

h4. Appearance

* !asset #29183903

h4. See also

* [[Monty Mole]]

title: calne_ca_(deino)
body:
Calne Ca, pronounced "karune shiie", is [[Deino (deino3330)|]]'s character from his [[Ca (maeda_koutarou)|]] series of works. 
Her given name is pronounced as letters, the same as the elemental symbol for Calcium, "Ca".

She has one red mechanical eye on the left, and both of her legs are twisted metal. Her right arm is made of the same twisted metal, her left is elongated bone starting just below the shoulder. And, most notably, metal finger-like protrusions sit under her face in place of a bottom jaw. She sometimes has an [[isopod]] in her hair which she calls "[[Nato-kun]]".
The amount of mechanical parts may vary depending on the illustration. In some images, she is completely humanoid. 
Her true form is a mechanical skeleton called "Ca (calcium)."

A variation of her with more insectoid features appears in the video [[Saikin Osen - Bacterial Contamination - (vocaloid)|]].

She often cosplays [[Hatsune Miku]] and appears in [[Vocaloid]] videos, but should not be confused for a Vocaloid character.

h6.Machine Muzik 

* NicoNico video: http://www.nicovideo.jp/watch/sm7517638

title: off-shoulder_jacket
body:
A [[jacket]] that is [i]naturally designed[/i] with a low and wide-cut neckline, not covering the shoulders or upper chest area, leaving them [[bare shoulders|bare]].

h4.Correct examples
* !post #4840348
* !post #4562464
* !post #4068521
* !post #6951071

h4.Incorrect examples
Regular jackets worn hanging off the arms ([[jacket partially removed]]) are [b]not[/b] off-shoulder jackets. This a common misuse of the tag usage; how a person chooses to wear their jacket is not the same as the jacket designed to be worn this way.

* !post #7849284: The jacket can be pulled up and worn normally without hanging off the arms
* !post #9362911: The jacket can be pulled up and worn normally without hanging off the arms
* !post #9593281
* !post #7375673
* !post #3629456
* !post #3643155
* !post #7090588
* !post #8014322

Jackets that are merely [[jacket_on_shoulders|worn on the shoulders like capes]] are [b]not[/b] off-shoulder jackets.

* !post #5405222
* !post #6745523
* !post #9364374
* !post #7350938

If unsure whether or not the clothing in question qualifies as an off-shoulder jacket, use the [[off shoulder]] tag instead.

h4.See also

* topic #17674
* [[Off-shoulder coat]] (another frequently misused "off-shoulder" tag)
* [[List of commonly misused tags]]
* [[Off shoulder]]
* [[Off-shoulder dress]]
* [[Off-shoulder shirt]]
* [[Off-shoulder sweater]]
* [[Off-shoulder one-piece swimsuit]]

title: re:stage!
body:
Re:Stage! (Re:ステージ!) is a Japanese multimedia franchise by Pony Canyon and Comptiq. It features character design and illustrations by artist [[Izumi Tsubasu]], series composition and story by Team Yoree, and music by Yamamoto Kouta. The story revolves around female junior high school idols who aim to become a top in Prism Stage, a nationwide tournament where many middle school idols compete and become top idols. These girls are divided into several units. Their stories are serialized in monthly Comptiq and short stories are released online via the official website.

A manga series and several unit singles has been released. A mobile rhythm game developed by Hotarubi titled "Re:Stage! Prism Step":[http://rst-project.com/ps/] (Re:ステージ！プリズムステップ) was released on July 31, 2017 for Android and August 5, 2017 for iOS. An anime television series titled "Re:Stage! Dream Days♪":[https://rst-anime.com/] (Re:ステージ!ドリームデイズ♪) by Yumeta Company and Graphinica premiered on July 7, 2019.

On the whole, they are little spirits that have a gentle temperament, much like Slimes, but they can sometimes explode into a rage.

title: earth_defense_force_2017
body: The third game in the [[Earth Defense Force]] series, also known as Earth Defense Force 2017. It is followed by [[Earth Defense Force 2025]].

title: earth_defense_force_2025
body: The 4th game in the [[Earth Defense Force]] series and the sequel to [[Earth Defense Force 2017]]. A remastered version, titled [i]Earth Defense Force 4.1: The Shadow of New Despair[/i], was released for the PlayStation 4 and PC in 2016.

title: mysterious_scientist_(edf5)
body:
A female scientist featured in [[earth defense force 5|Earth Defense Force 5]] in voiceover only. She serves as the player character's contact for the Spritefall line of orbital laser weapons. Notable for her excitable attitude and overwhelming enthusiasm with regard to the weapon and its host satellite which she appears to have been the creator of.

Credited as "mad scientist" in the English localization.

title: earth_defense_force_6
body: The 6th game in the [[Earth Defense Force]] series of games, it's the follow up to [[Earth Defense Force 5]] dealing with the aftermath of 5's Primer invasion.

title: earth_defense_force
body: A series of games about blowing up giant bugs (and occasionally other sorts of aliens) with over-the-top weapons. Each two games are set in their own universe separate from the others.

title: jr.
body:
Major playable character of the [[Xenosaga]] series and the main protagonist of [[Xenosaga Episode II|Episode II]]. 

Brother to [[Gaignun Kukai]], [[Albedo Piazzolla]], and [[Citrine]].
other_names: ガイナン・クーカイ・Jr.

title: asymmetrical_gloves
body:
Gloves that, by design, lack symmetry. 

* For differences in length, use [[uneven gloves]].
* For differences in color or pattern, use [[mismatched gloves]].

h4. See also

* [[asymmetrical footwear]]
* [[asymmetrical legwear]]
* [[asymmetrical sleeves]]
* [[single glove]]

title: kitchen_knife
body:
A type of [[knife]] used for preparing food.

h4. See also

* [[cleaver]]
* [[santoku knife]]

title: santoku_knife
body:
A Japanese [[kitchen knife]] with a straight edge and a curved back.

It designed to handle a variety of ingredients and able tо chop, slice and dice. In comparison to a chef's knife, a santoku is usually shorter, thinner, doesn't have a bolster and is limited in rocking motion cutting due to less pronounced cutting edge curvature.

h4. Examples

* !post #8229816

title: polka_dot
body:
A pattern composed of same-sized circles spaced equally. 

Depending on context, such as if the circles are dot-size and are used as texture rather than pattern print, [[ben-day dots]] should be used instead. Not to be confused with [[halftone]].

h4. Examples

* !post #8520777: [[polka dot hair]] and [[polka dot bow]] vs [[ben-day dots]] elsewhere.

h4. See also

* [[Ben-day dots]]

title: linea_nigra
body:
A [i]linea nigra[/i] (Latin for "black line"), is an area of hyperpigmentation (darkening of skin) that runs down the abdomen in the form of a thin line, seen during pregnancy. It occurs due to increased levels of melanocyte-stimulating hormone, which is also responsible for the [[dark_nipples|darkening of nipples]] in pregnant women.

h4. See also:

* [[pregnant]]
* [[dark nipples]]

title: bramball
body:
A plant-like enemy from the [[Mario (series)|Mario series]] that first appeared in [[New Super Mario Bros. Wii]]. They flip their legs left or right when walking on flat surfaces, resembling a [[slinky]]. Touching the legs or feet damages the player. Hitting the head defeats the whole Bramball.

Bramballs are depicted as a creature with an orange ball-shaped head with a face resembling a [[Pokey (mario)|]] that is [[frown]]ing. They have yellow [[suction cups|suction cup]] feet and [[thorns|thorny]] [[vines]] for legs.

title: adriana_ortega's_boyfriend
body:
The older boyfriend of [[Adriana Ortega]] from [[Clinical Trial (Game)|Clinical Trial]]. Like Adriana, his design predates the game. Unlike his girlfriend, however, he makes no appearance in the game and is only mentioned once as the person who picks her up from her appointments.

He appears to be in his late-teens to early-twenties in artworks that picture the two together when Adriana was a child. Adriana herself was aged up for her in-game appearance, but given that her boyfriend has seemingly not been drawn since the game's release, it's unknown if the continuity of their age difference has been maintained.

title: waffen-ss
body:
The combat branch of the [[Nazi]] Party's paramilitary [i]Schutzstaffel[/i] (SS) organization. [[Heinrich Luitpold Himmler|Heinrich Himmler]], [[Josef Mengele]] and [[Michael Wittmann]] were some of the prominent members.

Generally recognized by the all black [[uniform]] worn by the officers, despite most units did not wear the iconic black SS uniform outside of Germany. Instead they and the [[soldier]]s wore the similar field grey [[military uniform]] of the [[Wehrmacht]]. Pay attention to the specific [[SS insignia|insignia]].

Do not use for fictional uniforms or outfits modelled after the SS uniform.

h4. See also

* [[Black Sun (symbol)|]]
* [[Siegrunen]]
* [[Totenkopf]]
* [[Wolfsangel]]
* [[List of Armed Forces]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Waffen-SS":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Waffen-SS

title: clinical_trial_(game)
body:
Clinical Trial is a free RPGmaker game made by [[Homunculus100|homie]]. The game contains horror elements and disturbing themes.

The official itch.io page describes the game as "A suspense tale about signing up to test psychiatric drugs for money and provider-patient relations."

The story follows [[Angel Martinez]], a young college dropout who has decided to participate in a clinical trial for a new medication designed to help treat ADHD or ADD. The trial takes place of the course of 8 weeks and Angel must be injected with the medication weekly. At the end of the final week, they are supposed to receive a reward of one thousand US dollars. The deuteragonist is a mid-level PMHNP (Psychiatric Mental Health Nurse Practitioner) and data collector named [[Lee Smith]] who will administer them the drug.

The first half of the game focuses on the events that take place during the 8 weeks of the clinical trial. After that point, the setting of the game changes and the relationship between the two main characters does as well. The game has two endings, whichever is reached is determined by how the player chooses to navigate that change in relationship.

h4. Characters

* [[Angel Martinez]]
* [[Lee Smith]]
* [[Adriana Ortega]]
* [[Brandon hoff]]

h4. External Links
* "Official Itch.io page":[https://homieshouse.itch.io/clinical-trial]

Snow Pokeys are depicted as a [[snowman]]-like Pokey with [[icicle]]s as [[spikes]], a [[carrot]] for a nose and a red [[bucket]] on their head. Instead of [[smile|smiling]], they always have a [[:o]] expression.

title: gridman_sigma
body:
Gridman Sigma was the proposed ally of [[Gridman (denkou choujin)|]] in a sequel series that was never completed or even aired. Sigma would have become the alter ego of [[Toudou Takeshi]], a reformed antagonist of the original series. Sigma would have fought a relative of [[Kahn Digifier]].

In 2015, Gridman Sigma made his first public appearance in the anime short, [[Denkou Choujin Gridman: boys invent great hero]] where he is finally partnered with Toudou Takeshi.

title: zuikaku_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the Japanese aircraft carrier [i]Zuikaku[/i]. Character design by [[Konishi (koconatu)|]], voiced by [[Nomizu Iori]].

She has [[long_hair|long]] dark [[green hair]] in [[twintails]], [[yellow_eyes|yellow]]/[[green eyes]], and [[small breasts]]/[[flat chest]]. Her default outfit is a [[nontraditional miko]] set comprising a [[white kimono]] top, [[red skirt|red]] [[hakama short skirt]], [[black thighhighs|black]] [[thigh boots]] with [[rudder footwear|rudder and propeller]] parts, [[brown gloves|brown]] [[yugake]], and a black [[muneate]] with her identifier "Zu" marked on it. 

Her [[rigging]] consists of her [[flight deck]] on her left arm, her real-life hull to her back and used as a [[quiver]], and multiple [[anti-aircraft gun]] placements on her waist and thigh boots. 

In contrast with her sister ship [[Shoukaku (kancolle)|]], Zuikaku is depicted as a brash, hot-headed, reckless, and somewhat [[tomboy]]ish girl, in reference with her turbulent wartime career, in which she was credited for damaging and sinking several ships, but usually at a cost of large numbers of airmen.

She is frequently portrayed as a [[turkey]] and her in-game line "don't call me a turkey" is widely used as a joke on [[4chan]] and [[2channel]]. This stems from the IJN's notoriously poor performance in the battle of the Philippine Sea, where well-trained USN aviators referred to fighting inexperienced IJN pilots as a "turkey shoot". 

Her abyssal form is assumed to be the [[Abyssal Crane Princess]].

title: yuri_(project_moon)
body:
A character in [[Limbus Company]], appearing in Canto I.

She has [[grey eyes]], with one being [[one eye covered|covered]] by a [[gauze over eye|gauze]], and [[long hair|long]] [[red hair]] (or [[pink hair|pink]]) with [[sidelocks]], [[blunt bangs]], and a [[black bow|black]] [[hair bow]] tying the rest of it back. She wears a black-and-white [[jacket]] with [[red trim|red-trimmed]] lapels, [[black pants]] with a [[blue belt|blue]] [[thigh belt]], and [[black footwear|black]] [[boots]]. She uses a red [[glowing sword]] in combat.

She has [[Faust (project moon)|]]'s [[Lobotomy Corporation Remnant (identity) (project moon)|Lobotomy Corp. Remnant]] Identity based on her, and her outfit notably mirrors her coworker, [[Aya (project moon)|]]'s.

title: mona_(genshin_impact)
body:
A playable Hydro [[Genshin Impact]] character.

A mysterious young astrologer who proclaims herself to be "Astrologist Mona Megistus," and who possesses abilities to match the title. Erudite, but prideful. Though she is often strapped for cash and lives a life of thrift, she is resolved to never use astrology for profit... It is this very resolution that has caused her to constantly fret about money.

Sometimes drawn gathering or eating [[mushroom]]s, which are a required in-game material to level her up.

title: puffing_up
body:
An animal puffing up its body as a defense mechanism in a threatening situation in order to appear larger in size, to signal defensive aggression towards the enemy. In mammals, this is usually done alongside a [[bent back]].

Often accompanied by [[hissing]]. Though unlike hissing which is an offensive move almost always shown as a form of threat or [[angry|anger]], puffing up can be seen on other occasions such as [[scared|fear]] or [[surprised|shock]].

h4. See also

* [[cats are scared of cucumbers]]

title: cucumber
body:
A cylinder-shaped [[fruit]], [i]Cucumis sativus[/i], with a thin green rind and white flesh. It is prepared and eaten as a [[vegetable]], and is a favorite of [[kappa|kappas]]. [[Cat]]s have an [[cats are scared of cucumbers|instinctual revulsion to the sight of them]]; it is believed they associate their appearance with snakes.

[[Kappamaki]] is a kind of sushi containing cucumber.

h4. See also

* [[pickle]]
* [[Tag Group:Food Tags]]

title: akamatsu_ken
body:
赤松 健 (Akamatsu Ken) is a Japanese mangaka, born in Kanagawa prefecture, Japan, on July 5, 1968. Most of his works fall into the "harem" genre and feature ecchi material.

In his teenage years, Akamatsu failed the entrance exam to Tokyo University, and applied for Film Study instead (it is speculated that this is where he got the idea for Love Hina). Eventually, he became famous as an illustrator featured in Comiket (short for Comic Market, a comic convention bi-annually held in Japan). He used the pen name Awa Mizuno (水野 亜和, Mizuno Awa "[1]":[#dtext-external-links]). Akamatsu, still in college, then proceeded to win the Weekly Shonen Magazine award twice. His "A Kid's Game for One Summer" was awarded the coveted 50th Shonen Magazine Newcomer's Award soon after he graduated.

After a big hit with [[ai_ga_tomaranai!|A・I ga Tomaranai!]] (A.I. Love You), he finally made a grand success with his new manga, [[Love Hina]]. The series appeared in Weekly Shonen Magazine and has been collected in eleven volumes (with fourteen volumes in total), which have sold over 6 million copies in Japan, and received the Kodansha Manga Award for shōnen in 2001. Akamatsu had added elements of his own life experiences to the story, and this was said to have induced a unique feeling to the manga especially for Western readers, whose lack of familiarity with Japanese culture for the most part added to the effect. The series, published in America in 2002, was especially well received in many overseas countries - Akamatsu was surprised that even foreign readers found Love Hina to be "cute" and to their liking.

He is married to his wife 'Kanon' Akamatsu. Love Hina and the his manga after that, [[Mahou Sensei Negima!]] (Negima!: Magister Negi Magi), were made into an anime series produced by XEBEC. A second independent retelling of Negima by SHAFT was made called [b]Negima!?[/b] "[2]":[#dtext-external-links], but it never reached the popularity of the first series or [[Love Hina]]. It is has also been aired as a live action series. 

His current manga is [[UQ Holder!]], a story in the same universe as Negima. It received an anime adaptation by JC Staff that was based on a backup plot.

He later announced in December 2021 he would be running in the summer 2022 elections for a seat in the House of Councillors, the upper house of Japan's House of Representatives, through a nationwide proportional district with a platform "to protect freedom of expression, artistic freedom and creators' rights in Japan from foreign and domestic puritan and politically correct censorship, standards, regulations and influences" according to Wikipedia. His campaign was a success.

h4. Works

h5. Manga Works

* [[Itsudatte My Santa!]]
* [[AI ga Tomaranai!]]
* [[Love Hina]]
* [[Mahou Sensei Negima!]]
* [[UQ Holder!]]

h5. Anime Works

* [[Love Hina]]
* [[Mahou Sensei Negima!]]
* [[Rikujou Boueitai Mao-chan]] (Ground Defense Force! Mao-chan) (story, character designs)
* [[Itsudatte My Santa!]]
* [b]Negima!?[/b] "[2]":[#dtext-external-links]

h5. Live Action Works

* Magister Negi Magi: Mahou Sensei Negima!!

h4.See also

* [[Magi (cu-little2)|]] (assistant, circle mate)

title: katori_(kancolle)
body:
The personification of the Japanese training cruiser [i]Katori[/i] in [[Kantai Collection]]. Character design by [[Parsley-F]], voiced by [[Kayano Ai]].

She is a [[teacher]], carrying a [[pointer]], (or [[riding crop]] for some artists), and wearing [[glasses]]. She talks in a mature, maternal, gentle, but also somewhat flirty tone. Katori will occasionally experience a charisma break, however, in the presence of [[Iowa (Kancolle)|]], who historically "sank her":[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Operation_Hailstone].

She has light [[brown_hair|brown]] or [[silver hair]] tied into a [[folded ponytail]] with [[parted bangs]]. She has [[blue eyes|blue]] or [[green eyes]]. She wears a [[double-breasted]] white [[jacket]] with gold [[epaulettes]] over a white [[collared shirt]] and black [[necktie]] up top combined with a gray [[skirt]]/[[pencil skirt]], and [[pantyhose]] below. Her [[rigging]] involves a backpack-like rig holding up a smokestack and two twin-[[cannon]] [[ship turret|turret]]s, as well as a bridge carried on a strap like a purse. Her shoes in this mode are armored [[high heels|high-heeled]] [[sandals]].

h4. Appearance

title: miori_celesta
body:
An English-speaking [[Indie virtual Youtuber]]. Designed by [[Ozzingo]].

Originally debuted as part of [[MyHolo TV]]'s second generation, she graduated on March 21, 2021 alongside the rest of her generation. She joined [[Tsunderia]] as a "DLC character" to the [[Tsunderia Quest|first generation]] on May 3, 2021, until she graduated from the group on April 23, 2022. She has been an indie VTuber ever since. 

She has [[brown hair]], [[green eyes]] with [[star in eye|stars]], and [[medium breasts|medium]] to [[large breasts]], and is always shown wearing a [[musical note hair ornament|treble clef hair ornament]].

title: miori_celesta_(old_design)
body:
The original costume of [[MyHolo TV]]'s [[Miori Celesta]], referred to as her "1.0" or "adventurer" costume. Retired with the release of her [[Miori Celesta (guildmaster)|current default costume]].

This costume consists of a [[pink capelet]] worn over a [[pink shirt|pink]] [[halter shirt]] with a [[cleavage cutout]] and a set of [[detached sleeves]], [[shirt tucked in|tucked into]] a [[brown skirt|brown]] [[high-waist skirt]] and a pair of [[white boots|white]] [[knee boots]] with [[black thighhighs]] and [[garter straps]]. Underneath she wears a set of [[white panties]] and [[white bloomers|bloomers]]. In this look, she has [[very long hair]] that is [[blonde hair|blonde]] [[colored inner hair|on the inside]], and is adorned with a [[red ribbon|red]] [[hair ribbon]].

Later on, in March 2022, she received a variation on this costume, referred to as her "1.5" or "barmaid" costume. In this costume, the capelet is dropped, her detached sleeves are replaced with a pair of [[short sleeves|much shorter ones]], and she receives a [[pink bow]] on her neck, a set of [[wrist cuffs]], and an [[apron]] with a pin of [[Mogu (miori celesta)|]]. In this look, she has [[long hair]] tied in a ponytail with a [[red ribbon|red]] [[hair ribbon]], with variable bangs to extend her [[hair over one eye|hair past one eye]] and [[one eye covered|cover]] it. 

This 1.5 update also added the option for her to switch her eye color to [[pink eyes|pink]] or [[blue eyes|blue]], a feature that was originally introduced in her [[miori celesta (casual)|2nd costume]], and retroactively added through this update.

h4. Appearance

* !post #8150049: 1.0 Reference sheet (1)
* !post #5158311: 1.0 Reference sheet (2)
* !post #6304901: 1.5 Reference sheet

body:
The 2nd [[official alternate costume|costume]] pf of [[Tsunderia]]'s [[Miori Celesta]], referred to as her "2.0" or "casual" costume.

This outfit consists of a [[white sweater|white]] [[off-shoulder sweater]], worn over a [[black shirt|black]] [[halter shirt]] and tucked into a [[brown skirt]]. She also wears a [[green jacket]] over the rest of her outfit, a pair of [[black footwear|black]] [[shoes]] with [[black thighhighs]], and a [[white headwear|white]] [[beret]]. Her accessories include a pair of [[pom pom earrings]], a [[green bow|green]] [[hair bow]], and optional [[glasses]].

In this look, Miori has [[short hair]] with [[hair intakes|intakes]], and the option to change her eye color between [[green eyes|green]], [[pink eyes|pink]] (considered the default for this costume), and [[blue eyes|blue]]. This outfit also has a [[kemonomimi mode]] option, which adds a pair of [[cat ears]].

h4. Appearance

* !post #6304973: Reference sheet

title: miori_celesta_(guildmaster)
body:
The 6th and current costume of the [[indie virtual youtuber|Indie]] [[virtual youtuber|VTuber]] [[Miori Celesta]], referred to as her "4.0" or "guildmaster" costume. It replaced her [[Miori Celesta (old Design)|first costume]] after releasing in September 2024.

This costume consists of a [[short dress|short]], [[frilled dress|frilly]], [[white dress|white]] [[sleeveless dress]] with a belt [[halterneck|halter]] that becomes partially [[see-through dress|see-through]] toward the bottom, has a [[cross-laced cutout|cross-laced]] [[cleavage cutout]], and short [[detached sleeves]]. As the guildmaster, she wears a brown and a red [[overskirt|overskirts]] with [[side slit|side slits]] and a [[loose belt]] with [[potion]] bottles hanging from it. She may also wear a [[hooded cape]] or a tavernmaid [[apron]].

h4. Appearance

* !post #8371356: Reference sheet

title: fantasy_zone
body:
[b][i]Fantasy Zone[/i][/b] (ファンタジーゾーン, [i]Fan-ta-jī Zō-nu[/i]) is a 1986 [[science fiction]] and [[fantasy]] [[arcade]] [[video game]] by [[SEGA]], and the first game in the "Fantasy Zone" series. 

It was later ported to a wide variety of consoles, including the [[Sega Master System]]. The player controls a sentient [[robot]]/spaceship named [[Opa-Opa]] who fights an enemy invasion in the titular group of planets. 

The game contains a number of features atypical of the traditional scrolling shooter. Its main character, Opa-Opa, is sometimes referred to as Sega's first mascot character ever. 

Numerous sequels of the game were made and many have been ported to [[game console]]s over the years. 

The game design and main character had many similarities to the earlier [[TwinBee]], and together the games are credited with the creation of the [i]cute 'em up[/i] subgenre. 

[i]Fantasy Zone[/i] and [[Space Harrier]] share the same fictional universe.

title: miori_celesta_(emo)
body:
The 7th [[official alternate costume|costume]] of the [[indie virtual youtuber|Indie]] [[virtual youtuber|VTuber]] [[Miori Celesta]], referred by her as "Emio".

It's an [[emo fashion|emo]] outfit consisting of a [[purple shirt|purple]] [[off-shoulder shirt|off-shoulder]] [[crop top]] with [[detached sleeves]] over a [[fishnet top]] and purple [[cross pasties]], a [[frilled skirt|frilled]] [[black skirt]], [[asymmetrical legwear|asymmetrical]] [[fishnet thighhighs]], a [[black hat|black]] [[cat hat]], [[white socks]] and [[black shoes|black]] [[platform shoes]]. She also has [[bat wings]], small [[horns]] and [[lip piercing|lip]] and [[eyebrow piercing]]s.

title: kashima_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the Japanese training cruiser [i]Kashima[/i].  She was named after the [[Shinto]] shrine Kashima Jingu, but her name literally means "deer island".
Character design by [[Parsley-F]], voiced by [[Kayano Ai]].

Kashima has [[blue eyes|bluish]]-[[grey eyes]] with a [[tsurime]] style, and [[wavy_hair|wavy]] [[grey hair]] tied into [[twintails]], with [[sidelocks]] in the front. She also has [[large breasts]].

Similar to her sister-ship, she wears a [[white jacket|white]] [[long sleeves|long-sleeved]] [[double-breasted]] [[military jacket]] with black [[buttons]] and trim, along with gold [[epaulettes]] and a [[red neckerchief]].  She wears [[white gloves]], has a [[pleated skirt|pleated]] charcoal/[[black skirt|black]] [[miniskirt]], [[black_socks|black]] [[kneehighs]], and sandal-like shoes.  She wears a [[black headwear|black]] [[beret]] with two flag-like flaps of cloth accentuating it. These flags appear to be the [[signal flag]]s Uniform and Yankee. When flown together these mean "I am carrying out exercises. Please keep clear of me", referring to Kashima's status as a training cruiser. When damaged, it appears she wears [[no bra]] and [[no panties]].

Kashima's [[rigging]] involves a large pair of [[binoculars]], her depth charge launcher carried like a briefcase, her bridge carried on a strap like a purse, and a back-mounted weapons platform with twin [[searchlight]]s, and a large and small pair of twin-[[cannon]] [[ship turret|turrets]].

h4. Appearance

title: sun_shower
body:
A meteorological phenomenon in which [[rain]] falls while the [[sunlight|sun is shining]]. It can sometimes occur in a partially [[cloudy sky]] or even in a [[clear sky|clear]] [[blue sky|sky]]. It is usually the result of winds blowing the airborne raindrops into an area where there are no clouds.

One of the possible explanations for one of its Japanese names, 狐の嫁入り ([i]Kitsune no yomeiri[/i]), which literally means "fox's wedding," comes from the old belief that such rains are inexplicable and unnatural. In Japan, foxes (or kitsune) were believed to shapeshift, trick people, or cause them to hallucinate. It was believed that the rain fell to prevent people from seeing a fox wedding procession that took place during the day.

title: uss_zumwalt_(ddg-1000)
body: Lead ship of her class, new generation of US destroyers incorporating extensive stealth shaping, new advance gun system (with potential for railgun upgrade later on), and a host of other technologies. Originally intended to replace the Burke class destroyers as part of the next generation of naval surface combatants, cost overruns lead to the cancellation of most of the class as well as omitting a number of technological features. Currently used as a test-bed for various features to be fitted to other Burkes as well as well as future warship projects.

title: p-model
body:
Born out of the band [[Mandrake (band)|]], and consistently headed by [[Hirasawa Susumu]], P-MODEL is an influential Japanese electronic rock band, playing from 1979 to the year 2000. Aside from Hirasawa, the band's lineup would change and morph throughout the years, including others such as [[Akiyama Katsuhiko]], [[Tanaka Yasumi]], [[Tainaka Sadatoshi]], [[Nakano Teruo]], [[Kotobuki Hikaru]] and [[Konishi Kenji]]. 

[i][[K-On!]][/i] makes references to P-MODEL through the five main characters' surnames. Many [i]K-On![/i] fan works make references to P-MODEL, such as in post #781159.

Several of P-MODEL's songs, such as Big Brother, Logic Air Force, and LAB=01, have become popular sources for otoMADs, whether it be strictly music-wise, or including their music videos, to Hirasawa's "disapproval":[https://twitter.com/hirasawa/status/1441011463603175426].

This tag also includes Kaku P-MODEL, which effectively serves as a solo revival of the band with only Hirasawa as its member.

h4. See also

* [[Big Brother (Kaku P-MODEL)]] 

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: P-Model":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/P-Model

title: big_brother_(kaku_p-model)
body:
A popular song from [[P-MODEL|Kaku P-MODEL]], [[Hirasawa Susumu]]'s solo revival of P-Model, released as part of the 2004 album Vistoron.

It became an incredibly popular 音MAD (otoMAD) option in the 2010s, with many sentence-spliced covers being made. One of the most popular was a [[Cookie (Touhou)|Cookie☆]] version entitled [b]Big Brother☆[/b], depicting [[Meguru (Cookie)|Meguru]] as Susumu's interpretation of the eponymous [[Big Brother (1984)|]].

Popularized Meguru's appearance with an [[extra eyes|extra pair of eyes]] and [[blush stickers]] replaced with [[extra mouth|extra mouths]] when she speaks Big Brother's lines from the song.

h4. External links

* "YouTube: Big Brother (Kaku P-MODEL)":https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=hOrTU2NNDVQ
* "YouTube: Big Brother☆":https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=A2mJKg2g5TY

title: the_fire_rises
body:
The Fire Rises is a [[Hearts of Iron]] 4 mod about the a global collapse in 2020:

[quote]
The year is 2020. The United States and Iran are locked in a Cold War-era standoff, while a mysterious novel virus has been spreading uncontrollably through central China. Russia, Saudi Arabia, and other nations brace for the shockwaves of a volatile oil market, and the Syrian Civil War enters an uncertain phase. In America, tensions are reaching a breaking point. The nation teeters on a profound social unrest — just one spark away. Disillusionment with the government grows as Congress and the people drift further apart as it is seen more and more as an institution incapable of making meaningful change. Across the country, communities prepare for the unknown. Guns are being displayed openly in numbers never seen before.

The worst is yet to come.
[/quote]

h4. See also

* [[The Fire Rises-chan]]
* [[THE LONG MARCH (TFR)|]]

h4. External links

* https://thefireriseswiki.miraheze.org/wiki/The_fire_rises_Wiki

title: republic_of_china_school_uniform
body:
The May Fourth outfit, or Republic of China era [[school uniform]], consists of a black [[medium skirt]] and a [[blue shirt]] with a [[mandarin collar]]. It can be in other colors as well, but this is the most famous combination. 

In the painting "May Fourth Movement" by Liang Yulong (梁玉龙) a woman can be seen in the front lines of a parade wearing this outfit, which is likely the origin of this particular color combination being the most popular.

h4. Examples

* !post #8544328
* !post #8497153

title: kamen_rider_1
body:
One of the two protagonists of the [[kamen rider (1st series)|original series]] that kicked off the [[Kamen Rider]] franchise.

[[Hongou Takeshi]] is kidnapped by the terrorist organization, Shocker, and surgically altered into a cyborg. Hongo, however, manages to escape before being brainwashed to do Shocker's bidding and uses his new power to begin his war against evil as the first Kamen Rider.

After the introduction of [[kamen rider 2|No. 2]], his gloves and boots are changed from green to white to avoid confusion. In the continuity of [[Kamen Rider the First]], he is dark blue with a white belt. In both the First continuity and in [[Shin Kamen Rider]], his eyes are rendered as whiter than No. 2's.

h4. Appearance
[tn]No. 1 on the left, No. 2 on the right[/tn]
