title: 2channel
body:
[b]2channel[/b] (2ちゃんねる, [i]ni channeru[/i]; 2ch for short) - also known as [b]5channel[/b] (5ちゃんねる, [i]go channeru[/i]; 5ch for short) since 2014 split.

A Japanese internet forum, often thought to be the largest in the world in its prime. It has over 600 boards covering a wide range of topics, as their slogan ('[i]From "hacking" to "side dishes for tonight's dinner"[/i]') would suggest. 

2ch/5ch plays a large part in Japanese internet culture and has created a culture and language in and of itself. [[ascii art|ASCII]] and [[shift jis art|Shift-JIS]] art is popular there and many [[meme]]/[[neta]] and characters have been created based on it. In addition, several internet celebrities have been born there, as have many collaborative projects and pranks (ie: [[Densha Otoko]], [[Buront]], [[Kasane Teto]] and the [[Vippaloid]]s). However, not unlike [[4chan]] of the west, 2ch/5ch is infamous for its near anarchic, non-existent moderation, which results into the site being a hotbed for political extremists and illegal activities.

In 2014, after the dispute about the domain ownership, the original 2ch.net domain was seized by a group of American shareholders led by Jim Watkins and renamed to 5ch.net, whereas the original founder of 2ch, [[Nishimura Hiroyuki (2ch)|]] (who went on to purchase 4chan's domain and temporarily renamed it "4channel" under the SFW boards) later opened a "successor" site based in Singapore with the registered domain of 2ch.sg. Both sites are still disputing over their claim of being the "legitimate" successor of 2ch.net to this day.

It is important to note that 2ch/5ch is [i]not[/i] an image board - it is a text board. Do not confuse with "2chan", also known as the [[Futaba channel]], or [[2ch.ru]], a Russian imageboard of similar origin.

h4. See also

* [[2channel (/livejupiter/)]]
* [[Japanese urban legends]] (/occult/)
* [[4chan]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: 2channel":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2channel
* "Homepage (5ch.net)":http://5ch.net/
* "Homepage (2ch.sg)":http://2ch.sg/

title: tactical_surface_fighter
body:
The name for [[mecha]] in [[Muv-Luv Alternative]] and it's spinoffs. After fighter jets and aerial weapons were deemed useless by Laser-class [[BETA (muv-luv)|]], humanity developed the bipedal Tactical Surface Fighter (TSF) to combat the extraterrestrial threat. 

As fighter development was ground to a halt in the series' alternate history, many TSFs [[name connection|share their names]] with real world [[fighter jet]]s.

[[Tactical Surface Attacker|]] (TSA) is a production variant of the standard TSF.

title: age_difference
body:
A pair (or more) of characters who are interacting with one another with a highly-visible apparent difference between their ages, based on visual cues such as physical maturity, size, etc.

If the difference in ages is not readily-apparent from the image itself (by cues such as physical maturity, size, etc), do not use this tag.  Similarly, the tag may be used for any picture where there appears to be a wide gap in age, as long as that is the logical conclusion from the image itself.

If it's same character in their different ages, use [[age comparison]].

h5. Pairings
* [[onee-loli]]: older woman and younger girl
* [[onee-shota]]: older woman and younger boy
* [[onii-shota]]: older man and younger boy

h4. See also

* [[height difference]]
* [[size difference]]

title: qujupao
body:
A style of [[hanfu]] that was worn as informal wear during the Spring & Autumn Period, Warring States, Qin, and Han Dynasties. It's construction is that of a long wrap-around [[robe]] with a y-shaped collar and a [[sash]] around the waist or hips. Its hem is curved, this detail distinguishes it from the [[zhijupao]], which has a straight hem. These two styles are refered to as "shenyi" and could be worn by any gender.

Shenyi should not be confused with [[kimono]].

h4. Examples

* !post #7544053
* !post #8763813: left: [[kimono]], right: qujupao
* !post #9659863

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Shenyi":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Shenyi]

title: kotobuki_tsumugi
body:
A main character of [[K-On!]] with [[thick eyebrows]].

The Light Music Club's [[keyboard_(instrument)|]]ist, [[playing piano|playing]] a 76-key Korg Triton Extreme. Sweet, gentle, and hailing from a wealthy family, Tsumugi also brings [[tea]] and confectioneries to her bandmates, but also has a strange tendency to be excited at the sight of two girls in intimate interaction.

She is often referred to as simply "Mugi" by her classmates.

She has [[blue eyes]] and [[long hair|long]] [[blonde hair]] with [[bangs]], [[hair between eyes]], and [[sidelocks]]. Usually depicted wearing the [[Sakuragaoka High School Uniform]].

h4. Profile

Birthday: 2 July 1991
Horoscope: Cancer
Height: 157 cm
Weight: 53 Kg
BMI: 21.50
Blood type: O
Image colour: Purple (original), Pink (anime)
CV: [[Kotobuki Minako]]

title: marble_phantasm
body:
[b]Marble Phantasm (Fantasy Manifestation)[/b] is the ability possessed by the Nature Spirits that are the Planet's sense of touch, allowing them to reconstruct the world through probability alteration. By connecting their will to the world, they can transfigure it into whatever environment they imagine. However, the same cannot be done with things like humans or animals, which exist independently of the world. 

Imagination Realization is purely the ability to freely transform one's surroundings.

With this ability, [[Arcueid Brunestud]] is capable of:

* [b]Changing the surroundings to become an ethereal crystallized form of itself[/b]

* [b]Disabling Thaumaturgical Foundation[/b]

* [b]Seal anyone within it in a confined space that is visualized as a cube that appears before her, who then can swipe her claws over it and cause anyone inside the cube to be disintegrated.[/b]

* [b]Produce man-made inventions such as clothing, money, laptops, whiteboards, a mecha replica,etc (Though she's more in tune with stuff that comes from nature so she struggles a bit)[/b]

She can also will into existence [b]the Millennium Castle Brunestud[/b] down to it's flower fields.


[[Arcueid Brunestud]],[[Altrouge Brunestud]] and other [b]True Ancestors[/b] are all able to use Marble Phantasm.

h4. Examples

* !post #9567059: Marble Phantasm - Event Storage 
* !post #8244252: Millennium Castle Brunestud

h4. See also

* [[flower_Field]] 

* "Type-Moon Wiki: Marble Phantasm":[https://typemoon.fandom.com/wiki/Marble_Phantasm]

* "Tsukihime -A piece of blue glass moon- Comic Anthology"

The 2nd [[official alternate costume|costume]] of [[hololive]]'s [[Yuzuki Choco]].

It consists of a [[nurse cap]], an [[open cardigan|open]] [[black cardigan]] worn over a [[short dress|short]] [[white dress]] or [[skirt set]] with a [[white skirt]], a [[pink necktie]], [[white thighhighs]] and [[pink shoes|pink]] [[loafers]].

Her [[official alternate hairstyle|official hairstyle]]  is [[long hair]] tied into [[double bun]]s.

title: amazon_(company)
body:
The Amazon.com/co.uk/co.jp/ca logo.  Normally, these are found on brown cardboard boxes shipped by Amazon.  On each box, there is usually one black, curved arrow, shaped resembling the mouth of a smile.

Additionally, one can find the Amazon logo on their website properties; these are usually yellow arrows shaped similar to their box counterparts.  A9 and Amazon.com both have favicons demonstrating the logo, and the page header of Amazon.com also carries the logo (amazon.com, from under the first "a" to the "z").

h4. See also

* [[Alexa (Amazon)]]
* [[Amazon Kindle]]

title: ector_(fate)
body:
A minor character appearing in the [[Avalon le Fae (fate/grand order)|]] chapter of [[Fate/Grand Order]]. An Earth Clan fairy who worked as a blacksmith on the outskirts of Tintagel, he became a paternal figure to [[artoria_caster_(fate)|Artoria Caster]]. [spoiler]When [[morgan_le_fay_(fate)|High Queen Morgan]] sent an army to raze the village and murder the Child of Prophecy, Ector sacrificed himself to help Artoria escape.[/spoiler]

[spoiler]In the distant past of the Lostbelt, he was also known as The Black Knight, and was one of [[Aesc (fate)|Aesc the Savior]]'s traveling companions.[/spoiler]

[b]Character Design:[/b] [[Nekotawawa]]

h4. Appearance
* !asset #20693190

h4. See also
* [[Ector (Orca) (fate)|]]

h4. External links
* "Type-Moon Wiki":https://typemoon.fandom.com/wiki/Ector_(Lostbelt)

title: tri-brigade_rugal_the_silver_sheller
body:
Known as the Kinslayer in the past, Rugal leads the Tri-Brigade alongside [[tri-brigade_ferrijit_the_barren_blossom|Ferrijit]] and [[tri-brigade_shuraig_the_ominous_omen|Shuraig]]. Originally from the Fang Tribe, He's a silver-furred wolfman in battle fatigues and a mask. He wields Gunblades and a Spright-energy infused hammer (after [[Kitt_(Yu-Gi-Oh!)|Kitt]] upgrades his weaponry) in combat.

Voiced By: [[Yasumoto Hiroki|Hiroki Yasumoto]]

title: scheherazade_(fate)
body:
Caster-class Servant in [[Fate/Grand Order]] who debuted in the [[Agartha (fate/grand order)|]] singularity as the [b]Caster of Nightless City[/b]. Has [[long hair|long]] [[black hair]], [[dark-skinned female|dark skin]] and a [[curvy]] design featuring lots of [[skindentation]]. She is a character from the Middle Eastern story [i]One Thousand and One Nights[/i], where she dated a king who killed every woman he courted with so they wouldn't be unfaithful to him. Scheherazade avoided death by reading fascinating stories to the king every night, stopping the tale at dawn each time so she could keep his interest. After 1,001 nights together, the king spared her life and married her.

She first appeared in [[promotional art]] for Epic of Remnant (post #2635525). She's usually grouped together with [[Nitocris (fate)|]] and [[Queen of Sheba (fate)|]] in both official and fan works due to their common traits as middle eastern queens.

[b]Character Design:[/b] [[Namaniku ATK]]
[b]Voice Actress:[/b] [[Inoue Kikuko]]

title: emd_dm30ac
body:
The EMD DM30AC is a class of 46 locomotives built between 1997–1999 by Electro-Motive Division in the Super Steel Plant in Schenectady, New York, for the [[Long Island Rail Road]] of the Metropolitan Transportation Authority (MTA) in New York. Originally divided equally between the two types, the fleet currently consists of 24 DE30AC locomotives (diesel power only) and 20 DM30AC locomotives (diesel or third rail power).

H4. Example
* !asset #28933102: EMD DM30AC on Hyde Park

H4. See also
* [[Locomotive]] 
** [[Diesel locomotive]]
** [[Electric Locomotive]] 
* [[Long island rail road]] 
* [[Train]] 

H4. External links 
* [https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/EMD_DE30AC_and_DM30AC](Wikipedia:EMD DE30AC and DM30AC)

title: gilgamesh_(fate)
body:
[[Fate (series)|]] character who appears in [[Fate/zero]], [[Fate/stay night]], [[Fate/strange Fake]], and [[Fate/Grand Order]]. 

The heroic spirit of the legendary Sumerian king. Identifying as a demigod and the 'King of Heroes,' he possesses the appearance of a [[blonde hair|blonde]], [[red eyes|red-eyed]] man in [[gold armor|golden]] [[armor]]. Some appearances depict him without his armor, revealing his [[toned]] body.

He is originally summoned by [[Tohsaka Tokiomi]] during the Fuyuki Grail Wars in [[Fate/Zero]]. Following his death, he formed a contract with [[Kotomine Kirei]], who helped him take measures allowing him to survive into the Fifth Grail War in [[Fate/stay night]]. While the Fuyuki Grail summons him into the Archer class, his existence in [[Fate/extra CCC]] is unable to be constrained by class.

In [[Fate/hollow ataraxia]], he takes a magic potion to become a younger version of himself, known as [[Child Gilgamesh (fate)|]], while in [[Fate/strange Fake]], he is the "False" Archer-class Servant of [[Tine Chelc]].

In [[Fate/Grand Order]], he becomes an ally and playable Servant as the Wise King of Uruk under the [[Gilgamesh (Caster) (Fate)|]] designation.

Notable for his arrogant and narcissistic personality, with him calling almost any other non-Sumerians or gods as "mongrel" (雑種 - [i]zasshu[/i]). He is enamored by [[Saber (fate)|]] for her beauty and noble spirit, her continual refusal of him only compounding his obsessive desire.

[b]Character Design:[/b] [[Takeuchi Takashi]]
[b]Voice Actor:[/b] [[Seki Tomokazu]]

title: gale_(baldur's_gate)
body:
One of the eight Origin characters in [[Baldur's Gate 3]] who can either be the player character or potential party member. A male human wizard prodigy from Waterdeep, and romantically devoted to the goddess Mystra as her chosen. However, after letting his ambition get ahead of his better judgment, Gale suffered a deeply critical affliction and was spurned by Mystra, driving him to win back her affections at any cost. As a romantic at heart, Gale conducts himself as gentlemanly as possible and is considered to be one of the "good" aligned origins.

[spoilers]The affliction Gale suffers specifically is a Netherese Destruction Orb that has been implanted in his body, a result of him discovering a fragment of the Weave. In a bid to win back Mystra's attention, Gale took in the Weave with the belief that he could personally return it to her. His attempt failed, leaving him with this curse. If Gale doesn't keep this orb stable, it will explode with enough force to level a nation.

title: super_sentai
body:
A [[tokusatsu]] series produced by Toei. Most popularly known in the USA as the source material for [[Power Rangers]]. 

The series is well-known for its formula, such as featuring a team of heroes with color-coded costumes, giant [[mecha]]s, and various "monster of the week".

h4. List of Super Sentai titles 

[tn]The American [[Power Rangers]] adaptation of each title is in parentheses.[/tn]

* [[Himitsu Sentai Gorenger]]
* [[J.A.K.Q. Dengekitai]]
* [[Battle Fever J]]
* [[Denshi Sentai Denziman]]
* [[Taiyou Sentai Sun Vulcan]] ([i]pre-Mighty Morphin Power Rangers Marvel pilot[/i])
* [[Dai Sentai Goggle V]]
* [[Kagaku Sentai Dynaman]] ([i]Power Rangers Super Megaforce[/i], costumes for "Power Rangers Battalion" Legendary Ranger Mode; & pre-Power Rangers [i]Night Flight[/i] parody)

title: sabazios_(fate)
body:
Alter Ego-class servant in [[Fate/Grand Order]] first appearing in the [[Rakurui no Tsubasa]] event. Prior to his true name being identified as "Sabazios":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sabazios, he was temporarily named [[Odysseus (fate)|]] [[alter servant|Alter]] by [[Novum Chaldea]]. He looks identical to Odysseus' [[Odysseus (Third Ascension) (fate)|third ascension]] but with [[red armor]] instead. He's available as an alternate costume for Odysseus as a result of him fusing with Odysseus' saint graph.

title: mixmaster
body:
A character from the [[Transformers]] [[science fiction]] franchise.

[b]Mixmaster[/b] is an evil [i][[Constructicon]][/i] [[Decepticon]], a sentient green, grey and black [[alien]] [[robot]] that can transform into a bright green and purple [[concrete mixer truck|cement mixer]] slightly resembling a Volvo F12 [[truck]] (but probably a Nissan Diesel mixer ike the old Tomica scale model).

Motto: [i]"How strong the steel, how quick the conquest!!!...".[/i]

title: help:home
body:
h4. Welcome to the Danbooru Wiki Help!

[quote]
Danbooru [dahn-boh-ruh] ([i]noun[/i]):
1. ([i]on donmai.us[/i]) A repository of high-quality anime-style art and doujinshi.
2. A taggable imageboard, with sophisticated features for keeping, organizing and finding pictures.
3. ([i]Japanese[/i]) Corrugated cardboard box.
[/quote]


h5. Rules

Please familiarize yourself with the [[help:upload rules|Upload Rules]], [[help:community rules|Community Rules]] and the "Terms of Service":[/terms_of_service]. All users are obliged to follow these rules for everyone's benefit.

title: imminent_kiss
body:
The moment just before when two characters are about to [[kiss]].

The characters' mouths should be in close proximity to each other. Often there will be [[head_tilt|head tilting]], [[blush|blushing]], [[grabbing another's chin|chin grabbing]], [[closed eyes|eye closing]] (alternatively, direct [[eye_contact|eye-to-eye contact]]) and other such bodily cues present.

Not to be confused with [[incoming kiss]], which is an incoming kiss from the character to the viewer.

Depending on how ambiguous it is, this tag may overlap with [[after kiss]].

h4. See also

* [[grabbing another's chin]]
* [[kiss]]
** [[after kiss]]
** [[incoming kiss]]

title: mona_lisa
body:
[b]Mona Lisa[/b] (a.k.a. [b]Gioconda[/b]) is a painting by [[Leonardo da Vinci]]. Painted during the Italian [[Renaissance]], it is a 16th-century [[portrait]] [[oil painting (medium)|painted in oil]] on a poplar panel. 

The painting is a half-length portrait and depicts a woman whose expression is often described as enigmatic. Its atmospheric and novel qualities continue to fascinate people, and has inspired many [[fine art parody|parodies]]. 

h4. Example

* !asset #24829296

h4. See also 

* [[Tag Group:Fine Art Parody]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Mona Lisa":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mona_Lisa]

title: cosplay
body:
[b]Cosplay[/b] [i](short for "costume play")[/i] refers to real people dressing up as fictional characters. This is somewhat similar to [[halloween_costume|Halloween costumes]] (and they can certainly overlap), but a good cosplay outfit is often far more elaborate.

This tag is also used to refer to fictional characters who are dressed as other characters from the same or another anime/manga/game/etc.

[[photo (medium)|Photos]] should only be tagged with the character being cosplayed and [[cosplay photo]]. In the case of anime characters cosplaying other characters, add a [b][i]xxx[/i]_(cosplay)[/b] tag. For example, if you have a drawing of [[remilia scarlet|Remilia]] cosplaying as [[hakurei reimu|Reimu]], you should use the following tags:

* [[remilia_scarlet]]
* [[hakurei_reimu_(cosplay)]]
* [[hakurei_reimu]]
* [[cosplay]]

Adding the tag [[hakurei_reimu_(cosplay)]] will automatically add the tags [[hakurei_reimu]] and [[cosplay]] for you (see [[help:autotags]]).

[b]Note:[/b] Besides adding the cosplay tags, be sure to also tag the associated copyrights that go along with the character being cosplayed.

h4. See also

* [[borrowed clothes]]
* [[borrowed hairstyle]]
* [[Ohno Kanako]] ([i][[Genshiken]][/i])
* [[Tag group:Artistic license]]

title: buddy_christ
body:
A parody [[religion|religious]] icon created by filmmaker Kevin Smith, which first appeared in Smith's 1999 film [[Dogma (movie)|]].

In the film, Buddy is part of a campaign ("Catholicism Wow!") to renew the image of (and interest in) the Catholic Church. Viewing the [[crucifix]] image as "wholly depressing", the Church, led by Cardinal Glick (George Carlin), decides to retire it, and creates Buddy Christ as a more uplifting image of Jesus Christ. The icon consists of a [[statue]] of [[Jesus]], [[smile|smiling]] and [[one eye closed|winking]] while pointing at onlookers with one hand and giving the [[thumbs up]] sign with the other hand. Buddy Christ was later produced as an action figure and a bobblehead. The image has since been turned into a popular Internet [[meme]].

h4. External links

* "Know Your Meme: Buddy Christ":https://knowyourmeme.com/memes/buddy-christ
* "Wikipedia: Buddy Christ":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Buddy_Christ

title: groundhog_day
body:
Groundhog Day is a 1993 American fantasy romantic comedy film directed by [[Harold Ramis]] from a screenplay by him and Danny Rubin. Starring [[Bill Murray]], Andie MacDowell, and Chris Elliott, it tells the story of a cynical television weatherman covering the annual [[Groundhog Day]] event in Punxsutawney, Pennsylvania, who becomes trapped in a time loop, forcing him to relive February 2 repeatedly.

h4. External links

* "IMDb: Groundhog Day":https://www.imdb.com/title/tt0107048/

title: harold_ramis
body: Harold Allen Ramis (/ˈreɪmɪs/; November 21, 1944 – February 24, 2014) was an actor, comedian, and filmmaker. His film acting roles include [[Egon Spengler]] in [[Ghostbusters]] (1984) and Ghostbusters II (1989), and as Russell Ziskey in Stripes (1981); he also co-wrote those films. As a director, his films include the comedies Caddyshack (1980), National Lampoon's Vacation (1983), [[Groundhog Day]] (1993), Analyze This (1999) and Analyze That (2002).

She has [[raccoon ears]], a [[raccoon tail]], [[red eyes|red]]/[[pink eyes]], [[medium breasts]], and [[long hair|long]] [[brown hair]] with [[bangs]] & [[sidelocks]]. She wears a [[short dress]], [[red ribbon|red]] [[neck ribbon]], [[brown gloves]], [[brown footwear|brown]] [[knee boots]], [[brown belt]], and [[arm guards]]. She also has a [[slave brand|slave]] [[breast tattoo|breast]]/[[chest tattoo]].

She resembles a [[child]] during her debut in the series, however, she rapidly grows up to an [[aged up|adult size]].

title: okiku_(banchou_sarayashiki)
body:
Banchō Sarayashiki or Bancho "Sarayashi" (番町皿屋敷 The Dish Mansion at Banchō?) is a Japanese ghost story (kaidan) of broken trust and broken promises, leading to a dismal fate.

The story of Okiku and the Nine Plates is one of the most famous in Japanese folklore, and continues to resonate with audiences today.

My new account is this - @Lewd_Rinjo18! My main acc @Rinjo_18 has been hacked, don't be fooled by any new messages from this account - it's a scam. title: scathach_skadi_(fate)
body:
Servant seen in [[Fate/Grand Order]] during the [[Gotterdammerung (fate/grand order)|Norse Lostbelt]], and is the queen of said Lostbelt. She is the Caster-class version of [[Scathach (fate)|]], having been fused with the goddess Skadi by Odin in order to avoid [[Surtr (fate)|]]'s detection. Her name is stylized as [b]Scáthach Skaði[/b].

Compared to the Lancer-class Scathach, Skadi is shorter by 6cm and is usually depicted with hair a bluer shade of purple.

title: dokibird
body:
An English-speaking [[indie virtual youtuber|indie]] [[virtual YouTuber|VTuber]] that debuted in May 2020. She is a legendary [[thief]] per her lore, and commonly streams herself doing art and playing games. She has two [[stuffed rabbit]] plushies named [[Mei Mei (dokibird)|]] (black) and [[Bao Bao (dokibird)|]] (white).

Her initial run ended her graduation on May 14, 2021, but she later returned to streaming in February 2024.

When streaming with [[Laimu (VTuber)|]], [[Mint Fantome]], and [[Snuffy (VTuber)|]], they are known as the "Sloppy Sisters."

title: ishii_o-ren
body:
A female assassin from the film [[Kill Bill]], and former member of the DVAS. Born from a Japanese mother and a Chinese American father, after seeing her parents brutally murdered at the age of 9, O-Ren took violent revenge on their murderers just two years later and went on to become a professional assassin proficient in sword fighting.

Her attire after leaving the DVAS is a formal kimono, which she adopted after becoming the queen of the Yakuza in Tokyo, backed by [[Yuubari Gogo]], Johnny Mo, Sofie Fatale and her personal army known as the "Crazy 88."

Her weapon of choice is a [[shirasaya]] [[katana]].

Codename: "Cottonmouth"

title: crusader_(tank)
body:
The Tank, Cruiser, Mk VI or A15 Crusader was one of the primary British cruiser [[tank]]s during the early part of [[World War II]]. Over 5,000 tanks were manufactured and they made important contributions to the British victories during the North African Campaign. The Crusader tank would not see active service beyond [[Africa]], but the chassis of the tank was modified to create [[anti-aircraft]], fire support, observation, communication, [[bulldozer]] and recovery vehicle variants.

title: marco_polo_(azur_lane)
body:
[[Azur Lane]]'s personification of the Italian battleship [i]Marco Polo[/i], as part of the [[World of Warships]] collaboration. Character design by [[Nineo]], voiced by [[Misawa Sachika]]. 

She is portrayed with [[long hair|long]] [[blue hair]] framing [[red eyes]] with a [[mole under eye|mole beneath her left eye]], and is tall with [[large breasts]]. Her outfit focuses on a predominantly black-and-red color scheme, featuring a [[black hat]], [[black dress]], [[black cape]], [[black pantyhose]], [[asymmetrical gloves|differently-colored gloves]] ([[black gloves|black]] on her right, [[white gloves|white]] on her left), and [[black shoes|black]] [[high heels]]. 

Her [[rigging]] consists of two hull pieces with lances and containing a 406 mm triple mount, 152 mm triple mount, and three 90 mm twin [[anti-aircraft gun]]s per side, while she is perched on a third hull piece with the [[Regia Marina]]'s real-life red-white stripes. She also uses a [[scepter]] as a melee weapon.

Her personality is incredibly boastful, much like [[Littorio (azur lane)|]]. However, her emphasis is less on [[yuri|conquering herself a harem]], and more on gaining riches and spreading Sardegna's glory to the furthest corners of the world, much like her namesake did.

h4. Appearance

* !post #4655121: Default
* !post #5020124: [[Marco Polo (The Queen Of Hearts) (Azur Lane)|The Queen of Hearts]]

h4. History

Marco Polo is based on the [https://wiki.gcdn.co/images/b/be/1936_BB_design.jpg](UP41 battleship design), which was intended to be a successor to the [i]Vittorio Veneto[/i]-class battleships.

The design of the UP41 was intended to improve upon its predecessors, with reinforced armor, better torpedo protection, more auxillary and dual-purpose weapons, and armed with a 406mm main battery to better compete against its opponents in the Royal Navy and [i]Marine Nationale[/i]. In typical fashion for Sardegnan ships, her dedicated gun fires SAP rounds.

title: vision_(genshin_impact)
body:
The proof that one has been granted the power of an element by the gods in [[Genshin Impact]]. It is usually represented by a [[gem]] with its respective element's color and symbol.

The vision's appearance differs depending on which region the wielder is from. The designs are as follows:

* Mondstadt: Circular, sometimes oval, and with winged shapes on the bottom and spikes on top. "Example":[/posts/4729924] (hanging from Diluc's belt).
* Liyue: Square, features facets, and whose housing consists of a point-side down square overlaid atop a octagon/truncated square. "Example":[/posts/5936072] (attached to Yelan's leg).
* Inazuma: Circular, surrounded by a full circular bow housing with a stylized knot at the bottom. "Example":[/posts/4932976] (attached to Kujou Sara's belt).
* Sumeru: Circular, with a leaf-shaped housing that has large points facing to the side, and small points facing downwards. "Example":[/posts/5499267] (attached to Tighnari's belt).
* Fontaine: Circular, inlaid in a thin border shaped like two ribbons with ornamental clamshell designs on the sides. Comes in two different standard forms based on the holder's Arkhe alignment:
** Pneuma-aligned characters possess Visions whose border extends into two criss-crossing ribbons around a spike on top and bottom, with its clamshell ornaments pointing upwards on the left and downwards on the right. "Example":[/posts/6715419] (attached to the pouch on Charlotte's right leg).
** Ousia-aligned characters possess Visions whose border extends into a spiral on top and bottom, with its clamshell ornaments pointing downwards on the left and upwards on the right. "Example":[/posts/6851993] (attached to Navia's upper left arm).
** [[Furina (genshin impact)|]]'s Vision, befitting her ability to switch Arkhe alignments, borrows elements from both Pneuma- and Ousia-aligned Visions. It is set in a frame that has clamshell ornaments pointing downwards on the left and upwards on the right (representing Ousia) and an elongated spike on the bottom (representing Pneuma), with four prongs holding the gem in place. "Example":[/posts/6850933] (attached to the bow on Furina's right hip).
* Natlan: Circular, inlaid in a thin border shaped as a saltire with insignia resembling spiral greca patterns common in Mesoamerican culture, such as in xicalcoliuhqui motifs. A spike adorns the in-between of the saltire points, resembling a [[primogem]] star. "Example":[/posts/8031896] (attached to Kachina's upper right arm).
* Fatui: Circular, with angled protrusions on the side, similar appearance to a military badge. "Example":[/posts/7318295] (attached to Arlecchino's upper back).
* Nod-Krai: Circular, inlaid in a circular border on the upper half. Resembles [[moon]].

All of the Valkyries have [[red eyes]] and the [[look-alike|same face]], while their hairstyles and hair colors differ. They all consider themselves [[sisters]] as divine spirits created by Odin.

title: distorted_halo
body:
Not to be confused with [[glitched halo]], which is not used to represent sensations and is a separate type of halo rather than a distortion of the classic halo.

Halo that differs from the standard one by the presence of interference or distortion. Caused by strong sensations that the characters experience. An artistic technique used by [[Blue Archive]] artists to depict [[orgasm]] commonly depicted in sex scenes.

Halo is also officially a representation of consciousness, and its distortion may indicate that the character is beginning to lose consciousness.

Types of distortion in descending order:
* !post #7905335: [b]Interference[/b]
* !post #7927660: [b]Deformation[/b]
* !post #6782418: [b][[faded halo|Fading]][/b]

body:

[spoiler]Created Kuja, Zidane, and their race of Genomes to act as physical vessels for the planet Terra's dead souls once that world merges with Gaia, the world that FF9 takes place on.[/spoiler]

body: One of the playable characters in [[Final Fantasy IX]]. A non-human from the Qu race, with white skin and a very [[long tongue]]. Quina loves to eat frogs and simply travels with [[zidane tribal|Zidane]]'s team to find more delicious food around the world. Quina's gender is not identified, and is even addressed as 's/he' in the English localization. Other languages refer to Quina as female.

title: oobja
body:
Singleplayer walking simulator game on [[Roblox]] launched in 2023. 

Oriented around a greyscaled [[Player Character (Roblox)]] walking on suspended platforms (typically beams) in the sky, the "oobja" orb initially speaks to the player via narrator captions and creating new platforms to venture elsewhere. Later on, the player character can directly interact with the orb in a more physical form. 

The game received popularity for its elements of consolation and reassuring the player character.

title: holy_grail_(fate)
body:
A golden goblet that is the ultimate prize of the Holy Grail Wars in the [[fate (series)|Fate series]]. It is capable of granting the victor's wish. It was corrupted by [[Angra Mainyu (fate)|]] during the third Holy Grail War, which would distort any wish made upon it in the two future Holy Grail Wars to be the destruction of the world.

In [[Fate/Grand Order]], there are several instances where multiple Holy Grails were used by the main antagonists to fulfil their plans. The player were tasked to retrieve the Grail by defeating the antagonists, thus the Holy Grails are earned after completing a major story arc or in some events. They can then be consumed to perform Palingenesis, a [[gameplay mechanics|gameplay mechanic]] that increases a Servant's maximum combat level, up to level 120. This is an optional mechanic that players can utilize, so illustrations depicting FGO Servants with a Grail tend to demonstrate that the artist boosted them in their own games.

h4.See also

body:
The player's character in [[Granblue Fantasy]] when chosen as a female. While the player may name her whatever they want as it's their username, her default name is [b]Djeeta[/b].

She has [[short_hair|short]] [[blonde hair]], [[brown eyes]], and usually wears some sort of [[hairband]]. Her outfit depends on what her class is but she is commonly depicted in her regular [[fighter (granblue fantasy)|fighter outfit]].

Voiced by [[Kanemoto Hisako]].

title: peppino_spaghetti
body:
The main character of [[Pizza Tower]]. Peppino is an Italian [[chef]] running a struggling pizzeria when he is suddenly confronted by [[Pizzaface]], who builds the titular tower next to his pizzeria and threatened to destroy it. Fueled by both anger and fear, Peppino stormed the tower to save his business.

Due to the guest appearance of [[Mort (mort the chicken)|Mort the Chicken]] from the 2000 PS1 game of the [[mort the chicken|same name]], who is prominently featured in one of the level's title card. This inspired a wave of title card art featuring Peppino [[crossover|crossing over]] with various other properties.
other_names: ペッピーノ・スパゲッティ

title: the_thinker
body:
The Thinker ("Le Penseur" in French) is a bronze [[sculpture]] made by the French sculptor Auguste Rodin.

The sculpture is that of a [[completely nude|nude]] male [[sitting]] [[on rock|on a rock]], [[hand on own chin|resting his chin on the back of his right hand]] while his right arm rests on his left thigh. The figure [[leaning forward|leans forward]], [[looking down]], as if deep in [[thinking|thought]].

h4. Sculpture

* !asset #29364156

h4. See also

"Wikipedia: The Thinker":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Thinker

title: men_in_black
body:
A science-fiction comedy film series based on Malibu / [[Marvel]] comic book series of the same name and chronicling the adventures of the titular secret agency as it monitors and polices extraterrestrial life on Earth. It is most well-known for the first three films (the first being in 1997) starring [[Will Smith]] as [[Agent J|James Edwards/Agent J]] and [[Tommy Lee Jones]] as [[Agent K|Kevin Brown/Agent K]], though there is a fourth spin-off film, 2019's [I]International[/I], starring Chris Hemsworth and Emma Thompson.

h4. External links

* "IMDb: Men in Black":[https://www.imdb.com/title/tt0119654]
* "Wikipedia: Men in Black (1997 film)":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Men_in_Black_(1997_film)

title: columbia_pictures
body:
Columbia Pictures Industries, Inc. (commonly known as Columbia Pictures) is an American film studio and production and distribution company that is a member of the [[Sony]] Pictures Motion Picture Group.  They're the world's fourth largest major film studio and a member of the "Big Five" major American film studios.

Their logo depicts Columbia (the female personification of the [[United states|United States]]) holding up a [[torch]] and wearing long and loose clothing.

h4. Film franchises

title: plump
body:
Slightly chubby, but not enough to be [[fat]]. A saying that goes around for plump is "Fat in all the right places".

The Japanese tags above are Pixiv's equivalent of the word, but be aware that not all Pixiv-centric uses of those tags fit Danbooru's definition. As with all other size-specific tags, observe the body and see if the tag actually needs to be used before adding it; make sure that the body is not simply “[[curvy]]” and that it’s not “[[fat]]”, either. 

Plump is mutually exclusive with [[fat]] and [[obese]].

h4. Examples
* !post #7846241
* !post #5020301
* !post #5212327
* !post #7589244

h4. See also

* [[belly]]
* [[belly grab]]
* [[curvy]]
* [[fat]]
* [[strongman waist]] 
* [[muffin top]]
* [[pinching]]
* [[weight conscious]]

For chubbier bodies, see [[plump]] or [[fat]].

title: scarface
body:
A 1929 crime novel by Armitage Trail.

The novel would be made into a film in 1932, and that film would get a 1983 remake starring Al Pacino.

The 1983 film follows [[Tony Montana]] (Pacino), a Cuban refugee who arrives in [[Miami]] to start a new life. [spoiler]As Tony and his friends get involved in the illegal but lucrative Cocaine drug trade, the movie follows Tony rise as a rich and powerful drug lord to his fall as his drug addiction, temper and paranoia alienate his family, friends and allies.[/spoiler]

The movie was a hit and is considered a cult classic, with many Hip-hop and Rap artists loving the movie as a "Rags to Riches" story. The movie would later have a 2006 video game adaptation, [b]Scarface: The World Is Yours[/b] for the [[PlayStation 2]], [[Xbox]], [[Wii]] and PC. The videogame is set in an [[alternate universe]] where [spoiler]Tony survives the ending of the movie where he kills the assassins send by his former partner Alejandro Sosa. After surviving the attack, a remorseful Tony blames himself for the deaths of his family and friends and decide to quit taking drugs, rebuild his criminal empire and take revenge against Sosa and his minions.[/spoiler]

title: destiny_child
body:
A Korean gacha mobile game developed by [[Shift Up]]. 

You play the role of a demon who lives in the human world working as a part-timer. Alongside "children," familiars born from human desire, you contend for the throne that Lucifer has left empty. 

Its servers was shutdown on the 21st September 2023.

Not to be confused for the former American R&B girl group, "Destiny's Child":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Destiny's_Child].

title: four_arms_(ben_10)
body:
Four Arms is the [[Omnitrix]]'s DNA sample of a Tetramand from the planet Khoros.

[[Ben tennyson|Ben]] as Four Arms
Four Arms is a humanoid alien that is twelve feet tall. He has well-developed muscles, two pairs of four-fingered arms, and dense armor-plated red skin. A black stripe goes from his chin to his lower lip, and he has four eyes: a main pair and a smaller pair below them, while he lacks ears or nose. He has whisker-like spikes on each forearm and two-toed feet.

In the Original Series, Four Arms wore a white [[T-shirt]] with a black line going down it and black pants with a strap on each foot that reveals his two toes and the back of each foot, and black fingerless gloves. He wore the original Omnitrix symbol on his upper left shoulder. His eyes were orange-yellow, and he had no hair.

In [[Ben 10: Ultimate Alien]], 16-year-old Four Arms wore gold wrist and ankle bands, a pair of black underwear that has a gold waistband, and two golden sashes that went across his chest. His eyes were recolored green, he had a black ponytail, and he wore the Ultimatrix symbol on his chest.

title: xlr8
body:
XLR8 (pronounced "X-elerate") is the [[Omnitrix]]'s DNA sample of a Kineceleran from the planet Kinet.

[[Ben tennyson|Ben]] as XLR8
XLR8 resembles a semi-armored Velociraptor. He has black orbs on his feet, a black tail with five blue stripes, and bulky claws on his three fingers that can only open and close. He wears a black cone-like helmet with a protective visor that slides over his face (that is part of his Kineceleran biology and not mechanical). When the visor is lifted, one can see his blue face, green eyes, black lips, and stripes running under and in between his eyes; the rest of his head's features are unknown. XLR8 wears a black bodysuit and turtleneck-like shirt with a white stripe on the center.

In [[Ben 10: Omniverse]], XLR8 is now taller and the white color on his shirt is replaced with green, which now covers his neck. The number of tail stripes have gone down to four, the black balls on his feet are bigger, and his visor is darker.

title: vilgax
body:
Vilgax is an intergalactic alien warlord and conqueror, a Chimera Sui Generis who serves as Ben's archenemy, and the main antagonist of the franchise, having appeared multiple times in every series. Ben considers him as one of the most dangerous villains he has faced.

Vilgax is a humanoid creature with a face resembling that of an octopus. He has tentacles dangling in the front of his face, like a beard. His skin is pale green with yellowish spots on his face and tentacles. He lacks any sort of visible ears or nose. He has red eyes.

In the Original Series he wore a black and red-brownish armored suit and gloves. His armor was spiked at the shoulder and arm pads. He had green sacs on the sides of his head. His mouth was attached to the sacs by a respirator.

In [[Ben 10: Alien Force]] and [[Ben 10: Ultimate Alien]] , Vilgax had healed from his injuries in the first episode of the Original Series. He no longer had red-brownish armor, a mask, or green cheek sacs. He wore a red and blue armor. He had a belt which was attached to the raygun pocket. He wore dark blue stockings with metallic squares. He had the Ruby Ray of Rouleau on his right hand, and the Shield of Seagle on his left arm. He now had just five tentacles, all on the front of his face, and his eyes were larger. He also had a metallic plate replacing the green sac on his head.

In [[Ben 10: Omniverse]] Vilgax no longer possesses the Ruby Ray of Rouleau or Shield of Seagle. He has regained his original green cheek sacs and now has dirty teeth. Additionally, two of his face tentacles now end with a spiky-looking shape resembling actual squid tentacles. His armor is similar to his Original Series, with the exception being that the cylinders on his arms are now gold in color. He wears black clothes underneath his armor along with black stockings. Moreover, he now has fingerless gloves and wears a headpiece similar to his shoulder pads.

title: wildmutt
body:
Wildmutt is the [[Omnitrix]]'s DNA sample of a Vulpimancer from the planet Vulpin.

[[Ben Tennyson|Ben]] as Wildmutt
Wildmutt appears to be a large orange dog-like creature with [[no eyes]], [[no ears|ears]], [[no nose|nose]], or [[tail]]. He stands on [[all fours]] and his movements are somewhat apelike. His teeth are very defined and his bottom jaw sticks out of his mouth. The various spines found all across his body function similarly to whiskers with tactile sensing, and are not fur. Since Wildmutt has [[no eyes]], he uses his sense of smell and hearing to navigate, which are aided by three gill-like nostrils located on each side of his neck.

In the Original Series, Wildmutt wore a black-and-white brace with the original Omnitrix symbol on his left shoulder.

In [[Ben 10: Omniverse]], Wildmutt's lips have returned to being black and his forearms are a bit bigger. 16-year-old Wildmutt wears a green and [[white collar]] with the [[Omnitrix]] symbol.

title: highbreed_(ben_10)
body:
The Highbreed (alternatively spelled as HighBreed), formerly known as Atasians from the genus of the same name, are a powerful species from the planet Augstaka, and were the main antagonists in the first season of [[Ben 10: Alien Force]].

The Highbreed were originally a white humanoid plant-like species with black hands and feet, a purple face with red eyes, along with red eyes on their chest. Above their black hands and feet are grayish splotches that temper off before the Highbreed's elbows and knees. They usually had four eyes on their face (though the count could range from three to six), and the placement of their eyes would sometimes differ.

The Highbreed had white skin flaps over their shoulders and stomachs, which could open to reveal two sets of wings with orange undersides and nutrient-collecting tendrils, respectively.

After the Omnitrix's DNA wave reconstructed the species' DNA, the majority of Highbreed now come in many different colors.

title: argit
body:
Argit is a con-man and a longtime friend of [[Kevin Levin]].

Argit looks like a [[furry male|human-sized humanoid]] porcupine/[[opossum]]. His height comes up to Ben's chest and he has big [[yellow eyes]] and black quills for hair.

In [[Ben 10: Alien Force|Alien Force]] and [[Ben 10: Ultimate Alien|Ultimate Alien]], he wore a black [[T-shirt]] with an [[brown jacket]] and [[blue pants]].

In [[Ben 10: Omniverse|Omniverse]] , Argit wears an orange, zipped up jacket with yellow accents, as well as orange and [[yellow pants]]. Inside the jacket he wears an off-white/pale yellow [[t-shirt]]. He also has longer ears and shorter hair, and wears piercings on his ears. The skin surrounding his eyes is changed to purple.

This tag only applies to the LostWord-specific design of EX-Rumia.

title: pyotr_wrangel
body:
A [[real life]] [[Russia]]n and also known as [b]Peter von Wrangel[/b] (1878-1928), he was a notable [[Imperial Russian army]] [[cavalry]] general who led anti-Bolshevik forces against the [[Soviet army]] during the Russian Civil War.

title: haile_selassie
body:
Born as [b]Tafari Markonnen[/b] and also known as the [b]Ras Tafari[/b] (1892-1975), he was [[Ethiopia]]'s last emperor. 

Became Ethiopia's leader during its struggle against Italy in [[World War II]] and modernized the country, he was deposed in a Communist coup in 1974 and murdered a year later. 

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Haile_Selassie]

title: lady_nagant
body:
Character from [[Boku No Hero Academia]], introduced as an antagonist during the Dark Hero Arc. She is a [[mature female]] with [[purple hair|purple]] and [[pink hair]], and wears a [[medium dress|medium-length]] [[sleeveless dress|sleeveless]] [[purple dress]].

Her quirk, Rifle, allows her to transform her elbow into a [[sniper rifle]] which can be fed projectiles through a hole in her hand.

title: kingdom_of_hawaii
body:
Also known as the Aupuni Mōʻī o Hawaiʻi, it was the royal entity that governed [[Hawaii]] from 1795 to 1893 and founded by [[King Kamehameha]] I. 

Abolished in 1893 when its last monarch was overthrown by ministers loyal to the [[United States]] and formally annexed in 1898. 

h4. External links 

* "Wikipedia":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hawaiian_Kingdom]

title: qajar_dynasty
body:
Dynasty that ruled [[Iran]]/Persia from 1789 to 1925, when its last ruler [[Ahmad Shah Qajar|Ahmad]] was deposed in a military coup by Reza [[Pahlavi dynasty|Pahlavi]], who established his own ruling house. The clan continues to exist to this day.

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Qajar_dynasty]

title: ahmad_shah_qajar
body:
A [[real life]] [[Iran]]ian monarch (1898-1930). Seventh and final shah of the Qajar dynasty, having been deposed by colonel Reza [[Pahlavi dynasty|Pahlavi]], who established his own ruling house. 

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Ahmad Shah Qajar":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ahmad_Shah_Qajar]

title: fukuzawa_yukichi
body:
A [[real life]] [[Japan]]ese [[samurai]], entrepreneur, [[teacher]], and political theorist (1835-1901). He appeared on the [[10000 yen note]] from 1984 to 2024 when he was replaced by [[Shibusawa Eiichi]]. 

Known as the founder of Keio University and co-founder of the Institute of Medical Science (with [[Kitasato Shibasaburou]]). 

h4.See also

title: 10000_yen_note
body: The highest denomination of the [[Japan]]ese [[yen]]. Features [[Shoutoku Taishi|Prince Shoutoku]] (C-series, 1958-1984), [[Fukuzawa Yukichi]] (D- and E-series, 1984-2024) and [[Shibusawa Eiichi]] (F-series, since 2024).

title: shoutoku_taishi
body:
聖徳太子 ([i]Shoutoku Taishi[/i], Prince Shoutoku) also known as 厩戸皇子 ([i]Umayado no Oujii[/i], Prince Umayado, lit. the prince of the stable door)

A historical Japanese prince and regent from the Asuka period. Prince Shōtoku was a real man, but the accounts of his life are mostly legendary. He appeared on the [[10000 yen note]] from 1958 to 1984, when he was replaced by [[Fukuzawa Yukichi]]. 

[[Toyosatomimi no Miko]] from the [[Touhou]] game [[Ten Desires]] is based on Prince Shōtoku.

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Prince Shōtoku":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Prince_Shōtoku

title: kitasato_shibasaburou
body:
A [[real life]] [[doctor|bacteriologist]] (1853-1931), credited as the co-discoverer of the plague bacteria with the French doctor Alexandre Yersin, and a partner of [[Fukuzawa Yukichi]] in infectious diseases research. He appears on the 1000 yen [[banknote]] since 2024 (replacing fellow doctor [[Noguchi Hideyo]]). 

Worth noting is that Kitazato signed his name "Kitasato" using "sa," which is pronounced "za" in German, in order to be called "Kitazato" in Germany, where he was studying. That signature was read as "きたさと" in English-speaking countries.

h4. External links
* "Wikipedia (EN)":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kitasato_Shibasaburō
* "Wikipedia (JP)":https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/北里柴三郎
other_names: きたざとしばさぶろう

A [[real life]] [[Japan]]ese [[doctor|bacteriologist]] (1876-1928). He was depicted on the E-series 1000 Yen note from 2004 (replacing [[Natsume Souseki]]) until 2024 (replaced by [[Kitasato Shibasaburou]]). 

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Hideyo Noguchi":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hideyo_Noguchi

title: natsume_souseki
body:
A Japanese [[Meiji]] Era novelist (1867-1916), best known for his novels [[Kokoro (Natsume Soseki)|]], [[Bocchan (novel)|]] and [[Wagahai wa Neko de Aru]].

He was depicted on the Japanese 1000 Yen note from 1984 until 2004, when he was replaced by [[Noguchi Hideyo]].

title: spikemuth
body:
[i]This rocking town has a punk vibe and streets crammed with shops lined up cheek by jowl.[/i] [tn](Official description)[/tn]

A town in [[pokemon swsh|Pokémon Sword and Shield]]. The site of the Spikemuth [[pokemon gym|Gym]], led by [[Piers (pokemoN)|]].

Notably the hometown of [[Marnie (pokemon)|]], as well as the base of [[Team Yell]].

title: ballonlea
body:
[i]A charming town where the people make their homes among the trunks of the towering trees.[/i] [tn](Official description)[/tn]

A location in [[pokemon swsh|Pokémon Sword and Shield]]. Located within a dark [[forest]], it is covered in [[bioluminescence|bioluminescent]] [[mushroom]]s. The town's sole access via land is through [[Glimwood Tangle]].

The site of the Ballonlea [[pokemon gym|Gym]], led by [[Opal (pokemon)|]] [spoiler](and later, [[Bede (pokemon)|]]).[/spoiler]

title: fukuzawa_yukichi_(bungou_stray_dogs)
body:
A [[Bungou Stray Dogs]] character, based off the real-life [[samurai]] entrepreneur Yukichi Fukuzawa (1835-1901). 

He is portrayed with [[short hair|short]] [[grey hair]] and [[grey eyes]], while he goes for traditional [[Japanese clothes]] ([[green kimono]] and [[black coat|black]] [[haori]]) in line with how he is portrayed in the 10,000 [[yen]] [[banknote]].

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Yukichi Fukuzawa":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fukuzawa_Yukichi]
other_names: 福沢諭吉(文豪ストレイドッグス)

title: shibusawa_eiichi
body:
A [[real life]] entrepreneur (1840-1931), known as the "Father of Japanese Capitalism". Prominently featured on the 10,000 yen [[banknote]] of the [[Japan]]ese [[yen]] since 2024. 

On a related note, his distant relative is the art critic [[Shibusawa Tatsuhiko (Bungou Stray Dogs)|]]. 

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Eiichi Shibusawa":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Shibusawa_Eiichi]

title: shibusawa_tatsuhiko_(bungou_stray_dogs)
body:
A [[Bungou Stray Dogs]] character, based off the real-life novelist/art critic Tatsuhiko Shibusawa (1928-1987), distantly related to the entrepreneur [[Shibusawa Eiichi]]. 

He is portrayed with [[long hair|long]] [[white hair]] and [[red eyes]]; his outfit consists of a [[black shirt]] worn under a [[white jacket]], [[white capelet]], and [[white pants]]. 

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Tatsuhiko Shibusawa":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tatsuhiko_Shibusawa]
other_names: 澁澤龍彦(文豪ストレイドッグス)

title: alcremie_(vanilla_cream)
body:
[b]ミルキーバニラ Milky Vanilla[/b] (Japanese), [b]Vanilla Cream[/b] (English)

A form of [[Alcremie]] that is off-white with a slight pink hue, and with pink lines. Vanilla Cream Alcremie with a [[alcremie (strawberry sweet)|Strawberry Sweet]] is often considered the "default" form due to its prevalence in official art and media.

title: guzma_(pokemon)
body:
[b]Guzma[/b] is a character introduced in [i][[pokemon|Pokémon]] [[pokemon sm|Sun and Moon]][/i].

He is the strong leader of a group of toughs in Alola called [[Team Skull]]. The group's rowdy members obey him, and his kindness has earned their devoted respect [tn](official bio)[/tn]. He specializes in Bug-type Pokémon.

He has [[grey eyes]], [[undercut]] [[two-tone hair|two-tone]] [[white hair|white]] and [[black hair]], and an [[arm tattoo]]. He wears [[asymmetrical eyewear|asymmetrical]] [[yellow-framed eyewear|yellow-framed]] [[sunglasses]] on his [[eyewear on head|head]], a [[black jacket|black]] [[short sleeves|short sleeve]] [[hooded jacket]], a [[white shirt]], [[black pants]], and [[white shoes]].

title: okada_izou_(dog)_(fate)
body:
[[Koha-Ace]]'s version of [[Okada Izou (fate)|]] depicted as a black [[pomeranian (dog)|]] [[dog]].

The design was done by Okada's [i][[Fate/Grand Order]][/i] illustrator [[Lack]], who thought his fluffy hair resembled that of a Pomeranian's fur. The Japanese name for the dog version is a play on his Noble Phantasm (始末剣), both read as "Shimatsu-ken" but with the last word changed from "sword" to "dog/hound".

title: okita_souji_alter_(fate)
body:
A character from [[Koha-Ace]], an alter version of [[Okita Souji (fate)|]]. Originally known as "Majin Saber" during the manga's [i]XP[/i] run, she was a Saber-class gag character lampooning the concept of powerful fusions and [[dark persona]] (Alter forms in Fate universe), being a fusion of [[Oda Nobunaga (koha-ace)|]] and [[Okita Souji (koha-ace)|]]. In [[Fate/Grand Order]], she appears as an Alter Ego-class Servant, and is a version of Okita Souji who became a Counter Force guardian, similarly to [[Archer (fate)|]].

She appears as a young woman with [[long hair|long]] [[white hair]], tied with a [[hair bow]] and decorated with [[tassel hair ornament]]s. She wears a red and black dress bearing similarity to a short kimono and long European style coat, complete with [[high collar]] held closed by a rope tassel.

Her swimsuit variant is [[Okita Souji Alter (Swimsuit Saber) (fate)|]].

[b]Character Design:[/b] [[Takeuchi Takashi]]
[b]Voice Actress:[/b] [[Yuuki Aoi]]

title: dune_(1984_movie)
body:
A [[1984 (year)|]] movie adaption of the 1965 [[science fiction]] novel [[Dune (series)|]] by Frank Herbert, directed by [[David Lynch]].

Its reception was quite bad, and remains somewhat controversial due to it being regarded as sloppy and an overall poor adaptation of its source material, and the fact that significant creative liberties were taken by Lynch, and due to the studio not wanting a 3 hour long movie it was heavily cut down. Regardless, the film is considered a cult classic having developed a die-hard following of fans.

title: avicebron_(fate)
body:
The Caster of "Black" Servant of [[Caules Forvedge Yggdmillennia]] in [[Fate/Apocrypha]]. A magus and philosopher, founder of the Kabbalah and creator of the school of magecraft that [[Aozaki Touko]] uses. His NP is [[Golem Keter Malkuth]].

Caster wears a featureless [[mask]] without openings for eyes or a mouth, a full-[[bodysuit]], and a [[blue capelet]]. Due to the mask he wore, it was impossible to tell whether he was afraid or even felt any emotion at all.

[b]True Name:[/b] Solomon ibn Gabirol
[b]Character Design:[/b] [[Konoe Ototsugu]]
[b]Voice Actor:[/b] [[Miyamoto Mitsuru]]

body: An unreleased platform game for the [[Super Famicom]] developed by Game Freak. It was a sequel to [[Smart Ball]].

title: smart_ball
body:
Smart Ball, known in Japan as [b]Jerry Boy[/b], is a platform game developed by Game Freak and System Sacom. It was published by Epic/Sony Records and Sony Imagesoft for the [[Super Nintendo]] in 1991. A sequel titled [[Jerry Boy 2]] was in production, but was not released.

* "Wikipedia: Smart Ball":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Smart_Ball

title: komakusa_sannyo
body: Highland-Dwelling Yamajorou The 3rd stage boss in [[Touhou]] [[Unconnected Marketeers]]. She is a yamajorou who can manipulate others with [[tobacco]] [[smoke]]. She has [[red eyes]] and [[long hair|long]] [[purple hair]] arranged in a [[ponytail]], hold in place by a [[yellow_ribbon]]; she wears a closed [[red kimono]] (often drawn [[open clothes|a bit more open]] to [[revealing_clothes|expose]] either just the [[cleavage]] or more of the [[breasts]]) with [[wide sleeves]], and a [[purple skirt|purple]] [[medium skirt|skirt]], both [[torn clothes|torn]] at some areas; wears [[geta]] in her feet. In her right hand she hold her [[kiseru]] (emiting smoke in the shape of a [[dragon]]), and in her left hand she holds a [[folded fan|closed]] yellow [[hand fan]]. One of the few Windows-era characters to actually wear complete [[japanese clothes]] canonically. Her surname, Komakusa (駒草), is the Japanese word for [i]Dicentra peregrina[/i], the Japanese [[bleeding heart (flower)|bleeding heart flower]]. Often joked as a duplicate or daughter of [[Watatsuki no Yorihime]] due to her appearance, or as herself as owner of a casino/brothel. What comes from her kiseru is also subject of jokes, either it is [[marijuana|cannabis]] or [[opium]]. h4. External links * "Touhou Wiki: Sannyo Komakusa":https://en.touhouwiki.net/wiki/Sannyo_Komakusa
other_names: 駒草咲くパーペチュア

title: bleeding_heart_(flower)
body:
A common name for several genera of [[flower]]ing plants in the [[poppy (flower)|]] family ([i]Papaveraceae[/i]), native to East Asia.

The bleeding heart plants produce arching flower-bearing stems with hanging flowers. The flowers have a distinctive shape, resembling a conventional [[heart]], with narrow droplet-like petals beneath, hence the common name. Common flower colors are pink, purple-pink, red, and white. The leaves are lobed.

h4. Examples

* !asset #23440347: [i]Dicentra peregrina[/i]
* !asset #23440360: [i]Lamprocapnos spectabilis[/i]
* !post #2629328: [i]Lamprocapnos spectabilis[/i]
* !post #6322348: [i]Lamprocapnos spectabilis[/i]

h4. See also

* [[Fuchsia (flower)|]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Dicentra":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dicentra
* "Wikipedia: Dicentra peregrina":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dicentra_peregrina
* "Wikipedia: Lamprocapnos spectabilis":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lamprocapnos
* "Wikipedia: Papaveraceae":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Papaveraceae

title: uss_yorktown_(cv-5)
body:
The class leader and namesake of the [i]Yorktown[/i]-class [[aircraft carrier]]s of the [[United States Navy]]. It earned three battle stars for combat service in the Pacific Theater of [[World War II]].

[i]Yorktown[/i] was a vital participant in two major battles between the USN and the [[Imperial Japanese Navy]]: the [[Battle of the Coral Sea]] and the [[Battle of Midway]]. In both battles, however, Yorktown was severely damaged by Japanese attacks. As the carrier was being towed from Midway to Pearl Harbor for repairs, it was spotted and torpedoed by the Japanese submarine [i]I-168[/i], which combined with its previous battle damage finally proved too much. The sunken wreck was discovered in 1998.

This tag is for depictions of the actual vessel, and for personifications outside of established franchises. 

h4. [i]Yorktown[/i]-class aircraft carriers

* [b]USS Yorktown (CV-5)[/b] 
* [[USS Enterprise (CV-6)]] 
* [[USS Hornet (CV-8)]]

h4. Depictions

* [[Yorktown (Azur Lane)]] 
* [[Yorktown (Warship Girls R)]] 
* [[Yorktown (Pacific)]] 
* [[Yorktown (Black Surge Night)]] 
* [[Yorktown (Blue Oath)]] 
* [[Yorktown (Battleship: War Girl)]] 

h4. See also

* [[USS Yorktown (CV-10)]] Her [i]Essex[/i]-class successor, named in her honor

title: uss_hornet_(cv-8)
body:
The third [i]Yorktown[/i]-class [[aircraft carrier]] of the [[United States Navy]]. It earned four battle stars for combat service in the Pacific Theater of [[World War II]]. 

After launching the [[Doolittle Raid]] on Tokyo and participating in the [[Battle of Midway]], it was involved in the extended campaign around Guadalcanal and the Solomon Islands chain. After being crippled by Japanese air attack during the [[Battle of Santa Cruz|Battle of the Santa Cruz Islands]], and in the face of an approaching Japanese surface force, [i]Hornet[/i] was abandoned by her crew and left adrift and on fire to be found by said Japanese surface force. Deeming her (as the Americans had) too damaged to repair, the Japanese commander ordered her scuttled. On October 27, 1942, [i]Hornet[/i] was sent to her grave by torpedoes from destroyers [i]Akigumo[/i] and [i]Makigumo[/i], but not before the crew of the former decided to sketch the wreck as it was too dark to take pictures (as depicted in [[Kantai Collection]] fanart  "here":/posts/1559875). Her wreck was located in late January 2019.

This tag is for depictions of the actual vessel, and for personifications outside of established franchises. 

h4. [i]Yorktown[/i]-class aircraft carriers

* [[USS Yorktown (CV-5)]] 
* [[USS Enterprise (CV-6)]] 
* [b]USS Hornet (CV-8)[/b]

h4. Depictions

* [[Hornet (Kancolle)]]
* [[Hornet (Azur Lane)]]
* [[Hornet (Warship Girls R)]]
* [[Hornet (Pacific)]]

h4. See also

* [[USS Hornet (CV-12)]] Her [i]Essex[/i]-class successor, named in her honor

title: tubba's_heart
body:
A boss from the [[Paper Mario]] series, appearing in the chapter 3 of [[Paper Mario 64]]. It is the sentient [[heart (organ)|]] of [[Tubba Blubba]] that was removed by [[Bowser]], making Tubba Blubba invincible. The heart controls the body as if he were a [[puppet]]. [[Mario]] must attack the heart to damage Tubba Blubba, where it eventually rejoins with his body, physically weakening him.

h4. See also

* [[Tubba Blubba]] 

h4. External links

* "Super Mario Wiki: Tubba's Heart":https://www.mariowiki.com/Tubba's_Heart

title: tubba_blubba
body:
A boss from the [[Paper Mario]] series, appearing in the chapter 3 of [[Paper Mario 64]]. He is a giant blue [[Spike (mario)|]] who is a follower of [[Bowser]] that was made invicible by him from having [[Tubba's Heart|his heart]] removed. He later starts devouring all of the [[Boo (mario)|]]s in Boo's Mansion, leading [[Bow (paper mario)|Lady Bow]] to request [[Mario]]'s assistance in defeating him.

Despite his appearance, Tubba Blubba is actually very sensitive and cowardly. He is nicknamed "The Invicible Tubba Blubba", although he does have a weak point, which is his heart. Mario can only damage him by attacking his heart before it eventually rejoins with his body, which physically weakens him.

Tubba Blubba is depicted as a giant blue Spike with [[orange eyes]], [[black sclera]] [[orange hair]], large orange [[lips]] and a [[spiked shell|spiked]] blue [[shell]]. He has a large [[patchwork skin|patch]] where his heart was removed.

h4. Appearance

* !asset #29223188

h4. See also

* [[Spike (mario)|]]
* [[Tubba's Heart]]

h4. External links

* "Super Mario Wiki: Tubba Blubba":https://www.mariowiki.com/Tubba_Blubba

title: dedede_clone
body:
The fifth major boss fought in [[Kirby: Planet Robobot]]. After the Haltman Works Company began its invasion, [[Susie (Kirby)|]] obtained a DNA sample of [[King Dedede]] and created a [[clone]]. This clone is purple in color and can divide itself into three smaller copies after it received enough damage. Once they've been defeated, they'll jump into a contraption called the D3 Cannon to continue battling.

Clones of [[Dark Matter Blade|Dark Matter]] and [[Queen Sectonia]] are fought in Meta Knightmare Retuns, created in a similar manner by the Mother Computer.
H4. External link
* "WiKirby":https://wikirby.com/wiki/Dedede_Clone

title: grubba
body:
A character from the [[Paper Mario]] series, he is a [[Spike (mario)|]] who is a major antagonist in [[Paper Mario: The Thousand-Year Door]]. 

Grubba is a retired champion wrestler who is currently a fight promoter at the Glitz Pit, along with his manager [[Jolene (paper mario)|]]. It is later revealed that he possesses the [[Crystal Star (mario)|Gold Star]], which he has been using to drain other fighters' strength, including [[Prince Mush]]. After becoming the champion, [[Mario]] confronts Grubba and defeats his enhanced form, [[Macho Grubba]], to obtain the Star.

Grubba is depicted as a blue Spike with [[orange hair]], large orange [[lips]] and a purple [[shell]]. He wears a [[black hat|black]] [[fedora]], [[sunglasses]], a [[black jacket]], [[green vest]] and a [[red bowtie]].

h4. Appearance

* !asset #29223138: Normal
* !asset #29240430: [[Macho Grubba]]

h4. See also

* [[Spike (mario)|]]

h4. External links

* "Super Mario Wiki: Grubba":https://www.mariowiki.com/Grubba

title: nagato_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the Japanese battleship [i]Nagato[/i]. Character design by [[Shizuma Yoshinori]], voiced by [[Sakura Ayane]].

She has [[long_hair|long]] [[black hair]], [[red eyes]], and [[large breasts]]. Her default outfit consists of a [[Japanese clothes|Japanese-style]] [[midriff]] [[white shirt]] top, [[black corset]] with a [[gold trim]], [[black_gloves|black]] [[fingerless_gloves|fingerless]] [[elbow gloves]], [[white skirt|white]] [[pleated skirt]] with black trim, grey waist piece with a [[kikumon]] (based off her bow), [[red thighhighs]] with [[garter straps]], and [[grey footwear|grey]] [[high heels|high-heeled]] [[rudder footwear]]. 

Her [[rigging]] consists of two connected hull pieces in a half-circle, fastened to her back with a funnel and containing her four 41 cm twin gun mounts and two 14 cm single mounts. 

Often portrayed as cool and professional if a bit prideful, being one (and the first) of the Big 7 battleships legally allowed by the Washington Naval Treaty system to mount 16-inch guns. Secretly likes cute things.

In real life, she was [[Yamamoto Isoroku]]'s flagship in the first months of the war (even gave the signal for the Pearl Harbor attack to commence from her bridge). She served as part of BatDiv1 with [[Yamato (Kancolle)|]] and [[Mutsu (Kancolle)|]] in the [[battle of Midway]]. After the war, she was used along with [[sakawa (kancolle)|Sakawa]], [[prinz eugen (kancolle)|Prinz Eugen]] and [[saratoga (kancolle)|Saratoga]] as a target at Bikini Atoll during [[Operation Crossroads]]. She was sunk after the Baker test from a combination of damage sustained on the attack on Yokosuka and the two nuclear tests.

title: mutsu_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the Japanese battleship [i]Mutsu[/i]. Character design by [[Shizuma Yoshinori]], voiced by [[Sakura Ayane]].

She has [[short hair|short]] [[brown hair]], [[green eyes]], and [[large breasts]]. Her default outfit consists of her real-life bridge wings as a [[hairband]], [[white shirt|white]] [[midriff]] in the [[Japanese clothes|Japanese style]], [[white gloves]], [[black skirt|black]] [[pleated skirt|pleated]] [[miniskirt]], [[red thighhighs]], and [[grey footwear|grey]] [[rudder footwear]]. 

Her [[rigging]], unlike her sister [[Nagato (Kancolle)|]], consists only of her four 41 cm twin gun mounts held to her waist and to a funnel on her back, plus a [[chain]] and [[anchor]] wrapped around her left leg.

She is sometimes drawn as a [[Mutsu (Snail)|snail]] due to her horn-like headgear.

Infamous for once having the lowest luck in the game (3, 6 at Kai, a more respectable 16 at Kai2), stemming from her historical demise (she suffered a magazine explosion which cut her in half while at Hashirajima fleet anchorage). Because of her fate, she is often depicted as being easily exploded with the slightest movement (sneezing, coughing, getting excited...).

title: i-201_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the Japanese submarine I-201. Character design by [[Hoshiakari (C2 Kikan)|]]. 

She has virtually the same uniform as her sister [[I-203 (Kancolle)|]]: a blue [[crop top]] and white [[sailor collar]], gradient [[neckerchief]], [[blue skirt]], black [[thighhighs]] with her name printed on them, and [[rudder footwear]]. Her physical form is defined by her [[long hair|long]] [[grey hair]] and [[grey eyes]]. 

Her [[rigging]] is also the same as her sister's, using two separate hull pieces with built-in [[torpedo tubes]]. Unlike I-203, however, she does not use 25 mm AA [[handgun]]s, but is instead shown holding a torpedo.

Like her sister, the real-life [i]I-201[/i] did not see action due to being commissioned late in the war. She was surrendered to the US Navy, who scuttled her to prevent the Soviets from acquiring information on her unique design.

title: mecha_knight
body:
The fourth boss faced by [[Kirby]] in [[Kirby: Planet Robobot]]. After [[Meta Knight]] tried to take on the invading Haltmann Works Company, he was captured and remodeled by [[Susie_(kirby)|]] into a battle cyborg. He was equipped with missiles, lasers, and an altered version of his [[galaxia_(sword)|Galaxia]]. A subsequent upgrade named Mecha Knight+ gives him a large, [[scorpion]]-like tail.

A mass produced version called [[Stock Mecha Knight]] can be fought in Meta Knightmare Returns and the True Arena.
H4. External link

Spikes are depicted as green creatures with [[blue hair]], large white [[lips]], [[green eyes]] and a small black [[shell]].

title: nintendo_3ds
body:
A [[handheld game console]] released by [[Nintendo]] in February 2011. Successor to the [[Nintendo DS]].

New features include an autostereoscopic 3D upper screen, 360 degree analog slide pad, 3D-capable camera, telescopic stylus among other upgrades.

Not to be confused with the [[Nintendo DSi]]. The 3DS has a circle pad above the D-pad, and its upper screen is wider than its lower screen.

title: katz_howan
body:
A character from [[Gundam]]. He first appeared in [[Mobile Suit Gundam]] from 1979. He also appears in [[Zeta Gundam]] (1985) as a youngster. 

Originally called [b]Katz Howan[/b], he is adopted by [[Hayato Kobayashi]] and takes his second name. [b]Katz Kobayashi[/b] becomes a member of the crew of the [[AEUG]] battleship, The [[Argama]], and fights as a [[Nemo (Mobile suit)|]] [[mobile suit]] and a [[Core Fighter]]/[[G-Defenser]] combat [[pilot]] against the oppressive [[Titans (gundam)|]]. 

[spoiler]Sadly, he dies during the final battle of The Gryps War at the end of the series, killed by [[Yazan Gable]] in his [[Hambrabi]].[/spoiler]

h4. See also

* [[Sarah Zabiarov]]

title: production_art
body:
A catch-all tag for either unfinished works in progress that lead to a final production work, or ancillary reference materials used in the production of a work. This is almost always [[official art]], with the exception of production work of individual doujin [[animated|animations]].

This includes [[unfinished]] and [[making-of]] materials such as:

* works drawn on [[animation paper]] to be used as with a [[peg bar]], or featuring [[trim marks]] for later editing
* [[color trace]]s
* [[partially colored]] art (when a reference or a piece of pre-production artwork)
* [[key frame]]s
* [[animatic]]s (very rough pre-production [[animated|animations]])
* [[photo (medium)|]]s or [[scan]]s of physical [[cel]]s used in a traditionally animated work

As well as production references such as:

* [[storyboard]]s
* [[reference sheet]]s
* [[information sheet]]s
* [[production note]]s
* [[color guide]]s
* official [[height chart]]s and [[costume chart]]s
* [[promotional art]] used in the advertisement of a work

h4.See also
* [[concept art]]
* [[key visual]]

title: key_visual
body:
A piece of art released by an anime studio as a concept and showcase of how an upcoming anime project will look, often a few months before its airing. 

These are often in the form of posters with the [[copyright name]] prominently on it, focusing on the appearance of the main characters. Along with them are often released [[reference sheet]]s for the same characters.

Note that this is different from [[concept art]], which is instead for something that is/was still in production at the time of its creation.

Not to be confused with [[key (company)|Key/VisualArt's]].

h4. See also
* [[production art]]
* [[anime coloring]]

[b]Shirotsugh Lhadatt[/b] is a member of the [i]Royal Space Force[/i]. He is a lazy, unmotivated young man who has drifted into his nation's lackadaisical [[space]] program.

title: kinkakumon
body: Kinkakumon is a rampaging girl that is feared as one of the "Gold and Silver [[Oni]] Brothers" alongside its little brother [[Ginkakumon]]. Since it's the type to rush headlong into a love affair, it's a romantic [[Digimon]] that will begin violently attacking if there's a Digimon it's interested in. In addition, because it is a thoughtless person prone to making silly mistakes and jumping to the wrong conclusion, if it falls in love with its opponent then the misunderstanding will cause a ruckus. Because it has a confident personality but is naive in the ways of love, it strikes the opponent and sends them soaring if it's bashful, and strikes them dolefully if it's snubbed, so no matter how many lives the opponent it likes has, they aren't enough. Its Special Move is swinging its "[B][I]Shichisei Kanabou[/I][/B]" from overhead and pulverizing the whole ground ([B][I]Kibakusou[/I][/B]). Its "[B][I]Dokidokidokyūn[/I][/B]", in which it discharges a high-tension current from its whole body, is an all-purpose technique that excels in offense and defense. Its lightning-speed, surprise kick technique "[B][I]Raikou Kishū[/I][/B]" conceals an electric shock in its foot and has a paralyzing effect on the opponent.
